programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples from Blackburn, Lancashire compete, beginning with beauty salon owner Carla and her fiance Marcus, the highly competitive Michael and Joanna and the more relaxed Trudy and Anselm. The parties include a risky chocolate souffle, a low-calorie trifle, and a curry that's far too hot for one of the diners.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: At London Road Pawnbrokers in Sheffield, owner Dan and mum Lena are trying to seal the deal on some inflatable water-walking balls and a large collection of gold.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: The owner of London Road Pawnbrokers in Sheffield has to deal with a bus-load of antiques and a watch once owned by Saddam Hussein. Meanwhile, 200 miles away at Pickwicks in London, Nathan and Debbs value an impressive collection of jewels and watches, a set of antique coins and a pair of luxury designer handbags.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.sub-title: East London and South London Revisits.
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer revisit two sets of property-hunters in London. In the east of the city, Kirstie finds out whether vicar Ian and his wife Peta successfully managed to downsize, while Phil catches up with Ben and Lucy, who hoped to find the ideal location south of the Thames.(n)

programme.title: Best of Both Worlds
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander assists Muj and Sufia from Essex in finding a new home, and also helps engaged Maidenhead couple Adam and Jody who seek their first joint property in Buckinghamshire.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to the Kilpeck Inn in Herefordshire where head chef Ross Williams and front of house manager Kath Capel consider no detail too small.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Simran Samra hosts the first party in east London, and decides to cook meat for her main course, despite being a vegetarian. The fashionista tries to salvage her chances of winning the £1,000 prize by performing a range of comedy accents after fellow competitor Alan Price upsets one of the guests.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Comedienne Yoshki Greenberg hosts the second dinner party in east London, but her decision to surprise the guests by asking them to wear animal-themed pyjama suits does not go down well - leaving her struggling to win them over with a stand-up routine.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Alan Price hosts the third party in east London, and sets out to impress his fellow competitors with a medieval-themed dinner. He hopes to raise the standard of the contest with an ambitious menu, but stumbles at the first hurdle when vegetarian diner Simran Samra panics at the sight of his authentic pig's head as the table centrepiece. Things do not improve as the night goes on, with dirty dinner plates and sloppy hosting leaving the guests less than impressed.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Bar owner Delia Elliot hosts the fourth dinner party from east London, and she is confident she can teach her young diners the protocol of entertaining guests. However, prankster Alan Price ends up having an argument with her, leading Simran Samra to take evasive action.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Doctor Chintu Gademsetty hosts the final dinner party in east London, and is confident of impressing his guests with a 1980s-themed evening. Even though his dance competition is not a hit with all of the diners, his food goes down a treat, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Nashville, Tennessee, the spiritual home of country music, but his visit begins on a sour note at Chappy's Cajun restaurant. Chef John Chapman's careless methods have damaged his reputation, but he blames the local clientele rather than his less-than-appetising food and disturbing kitchen practices. Can Gordon get through to this stubborn owner and save the eatery from disaster?.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: First of a two-part special in which Gordon Ramsay heads to the Burger Kitchen in Los Angeles, where tensions are running high because owner Alan Saffron has spent his son's entire inheritance on the struggling restaurant. To make matters worse, the kitchen is run by a chef called David Blaine who shares nothing of his famous namesake's magic when it comes to cooking - and whose threatening behaviour regularly gets him into trouble.(n)

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Barbara and Stephen have had 20 happy years in their Victorian riverside cottage in Surrey, but with retirement looming, they are undecided what to do next. Stephen loves their home, while Barbara dreams of starting afresh in a new home - where she would need a separate room for her drum kit. Phil Spencer comes up with a few options should they decide to up sticks, while Kirstie Allsopp is full of ideas allowing Barbara to get out her sticks. Will they decide to stay or sell?.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Great Gay Buildings
programme.desc: Stephen Fry is joined by seven fellow celebrities to mark the 50th anniversary of the 1967 Sexual Offences Act, which decriminalised private homosexual acts between men. The group explores the histories of several buildings that became cornerstones in the battle for gay rights in the UK. The Rev Richard Coles revisits the hedonistic past of London's Heaven Nightclub, while Mary Portas visits Shibden Hall near Halifax to celebrate the life of 19th-century lesbian heiress Anne Lister. Craig Revel Horwood investigates Britain's drag scene at the Royal Vauxhall Tavern, and Simon Callow tells the story of Oscar Wilde's downfall at the Old Bailey. Plus, Rikki Beadle-Blair visit the Theatre Royal Haymarket to remember how the British public showed their support for John Gielgud after he was arrested for cottaging, and Liz Carr takes in Bletchley Park, the one-time home of Alan Turing. Finally, Waheed Alli tells the story of recent battles for gay right in the Houses of Parliament.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: This edition follows the case of a man who was attacked and left unconscious on the floor of a crowded pub for more than 30 minutes, but no-one is prepared to come forward and name the assailant. The next day, detectives from Bedfordshire Police seize CCTV footage from the pub and though they can clearly see the vicious assault, they are unable to easily identify who threw the punches. Cameras follow every twist and turn of the investigation as the officers try to overcome the wall of silence they face.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: A man arrives at Luton police station claiming his life is in danger and that he has just escaped from a slave-owning gang that held him captive at a travellers' site in a remote part of Bedfordshire. Cameras follow as a major operation is launched to investigate the allegations, with more than 200 officers drafted in for a dawn raid on the site to arrest their suspects.(n)

programme.title: The Crystal Maze
programme.desc: New series. The popular 1990s game show returns - after last October's one-off revival as part of Stand Up to Cancer - for a full series, with comedian and film-maker Richard Ayoade stepping into the shoes of previous hosts Richard O'Brien, Edward Tudor Pole and Stephen Merchant. As the Maze Master, he will guide five intrepid celebrities - Ore Oduba, Vicky Pattison, Alex Brooker, Lydia Bright and Louie Spence - through the Aztec, Medieval, Industrial and Future zones, where they play a range of skill, mystery, physical and mental challenges to win the all-important crystals. The more they win, the more time they have in the final test - the Crystal Dome.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the words-and-numbers game, with Jon Richardson and Joe Lycett taking on Sean Lock and Michelle Wolf. Adam Riches joins resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner and Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: `Deadly' (aka David) found fame with his UK garage crew, and though he may be confident on stage, he's shy and retiring with the ladies. Can he bring his A-game when he meet teaching assistant Helen? Other diners include rock fan Anthony, who meets retired nurse and fellow northerner Barbara. She's an amateur magician with a few dating tricks up her sleeve.(n)

programme.title: Gogglesprogs
programme.desc: Young TV viewers give their honest, inimitable and hilarious take on This Morning and Doctor Who, and sing along to The Sound of Music.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef comes to the aid of a French restaurant in the heart of Moorpark, California. The pompous, over-complicated cuisine is keeping the customers away and there is an imminent threat of bankruptcy. However, the owner is vigorously opposed to change, despite the failings of his current business model.(n)

programme.title: Bodyshockers
programme.desc: Katie Piper meets a woman with a surgery-free solution to enlarging her assets - inflatable N-cup breasts. The programme also features Glen, who has vowed to transform his wife's body from white to black, and a woman who regrets an eyebrow raise that has left her seeing double. Plus, Julian cannot work out why he had such protruding pec implants, and a child minder wants to defy her mum with large tattoos on the backs of her legs.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples from Staffordshire compete to win the £1,000 prize, beginning with Jodie and Ben who hope their risky starter of lamb tartare pays off. Dave and Sian prepare a more traditional menu on the second evening, including a bread and butter pudding, and surprise the contestants with musical entertainment. Straight-talking Michelle is the last to host with Matt, but she could have already blown their chances of winning.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: At Pickwick Pawnbrokers in south east London, Nathan and manageress Debbs consider a deal on two vintage saxophones, and deliver a surprise when valuing an antique Japanese helmet.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: At Pickwick Pawnbrokers in London, Nathan and his sidekick Debbs seal the deals on an unusual life-size Majolica lion, a rare book, and racing silks owned by jockey AP McCoy. Meanwhile, at Dan's London Road Shop in Sheffield, the team values a selection of high-end rubies and an unusual astronaut jukebox.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer visit Aberdeen to help two sets of house hunters who have relocated to the city for work and need to find family homes quickly. Helen Barr and Brian Clarence moved from Essex while awaiting the arrival of their first child and have been living in rented accommodation, but with baby number two on the way, it's time to find a family home. However, Brian's main priority seems to be finding a bargain, while Helen doesn't want to take on a project. Meanwhile, Kirstie helps Kirsten and Scott Laing search for a semi-rural property so they can move their family up from Fife.(n)

programme.title: Best of Both Worlds
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander helps more home-buyers find a balance between town and country, including Sue and Richard from West Sussex who are searching for a peaceful, countryside home.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week takes place at The Fox Inn in Guisborough, where hosts Michael Crane and Jai Bennison hope to impress their guests with their northern B&B.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Posh girl-about-town Liv Sargeant hosts the first party in Bath, and hopes to impress with her sophisticated evening, complete with black-tie dress code. However, her unusual choice of entertainment, and her undying love for Michael Buble, threaten to hamper her chances of winning the £1,000 prize at the end of the week.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Former raver Mel Lewis-Leger hosts the second dinner party in Bath, but her taste in music and a spicy Cajun menu prove off-putting for some of the guests. Meanwhile, cafe worker Becky Tyler becomes more sociable, until she decides to do an impression of one of her fellow diners.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Handyman Jon Wicheard hosts the third dinner party in Bath. Denis Verrier suspects the food will not be up to his exacting standards, and sandwich enthusiast Becky Tyler also doubts the meal will be a success. The prospect of a disco excites vegetarian and former raver Mel Lewis-Leger, but society girl Liv Sargeant dreads the thought of any form of forced entertainment.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Cafe worker Becky Tyler hosts the fourth dinner-party challenge from Bath. The theme is a `Mad Hat' tea party, and she sets out to put on a menu of British classics, but the round of sandwiches for starters might prove too much for the diners.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Patriotic Frenchman Denis Verrier hosts the final dinner party in Bath, and hopes his experience of working in the hospitality industry will stand him in good stead. However, two of the guests are shocked by what they find in his wardrobe, and his staging of a penalty shoot-out provides more surprises, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Scottsdale, Arizona, where he meets husband-and-wife bistro owners Samy and Amy Bouzaglo, who reveal a shocking contempt for customer feedback. The chef faces the biggest challenge of the series to save Amy's Baking Company, but can he get through to this defiant pair?.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Part two of two. programme.title: Countdown to Murder
programme.sub-title: The Body in the Freezer: Countdown to Murder.
programme.desc: In March 2010, pub landlord Michael Tucker shot his partner Rebecca Thorpe in the head while she was having a bath and hid her body in a chest freezer in one of the outbuildings of his bar in Snettisham, Norfolk. This documentary analyses Tucker's emotional state of mind and the events that led him to kill in cold blood, and includes interviews with Rebecca's father Peter, Jes Fry of the Norfolk and Suffolk major investigation team and consultant forensic psychologist Kerry Daynes.(n)

programme.title: When Kids Kill
programme.desc: The case of a London gang who murdered 17-year-old Marcel Addai after an ongoing feud on social media, which saw gang members threatening each other in homemade rap videos.(n)

programme.title: Murder on the Internet
programme.desc: Crimes involving dating apps have risen sevenfold in the past two years with more than 400 offences reported to police last year - including assault, rape, child sex grooming and even murder. This two-part documentary looks at some of the most shocking crimes committed by people using online dating as a way of finding their victims, revealing why greater public awareness of the risks of using such apps is needed.(n)

programme.desc: Disgruntled Korean War vet Walt Kowalski sets out to reform his neighbour, a young Hmong teenager, who tried to steal Kowalski's prized possession: his 1972 Gran Torino(n)

programme.title: The Incredible Hulk
programme.desc: Doses of radiation turn a mild-mannered scientist into an angry, uncontrollable monstrosity in this adaptation of the Marvel Comics series. Lou Ferrigno, who played the Hulk in the 1970s TV series, has a cameo as a security guard and provides the voice of the Hulk(n)

programme.title: The Crew
programme.desc: Burt Reynolds, Richard Dreyfuss, Dan Hedaya and Seymour Cassel star in this comedy about mobsters who come out of retirement for one last job. Facing eviction from the hotel where they live, the guys try to scare off the owners with a staged shooting. But the plan backfires, and a hilarious comedy of errors begins. Carrie-Anne Moss, Jennifer Tilly(n)

programme.title: Johnson Family Vacation
programme.desc: Cedric the Entertainer racks up the miles and piles on the smiles in this wild road-trip comedy. He plays the patriarch of a dysfunctional California family, traveling to a family reunion in Missouri. En route, they encounter obstacles---and laughs---at every turn(n)

programme.title: The Ring
programme.desc: Naomi Watts shines in this thriller about a reporter who investigates her niece's mysterious death, which seems to be linked to a videotape. Apparently, anyone who watches the tape dies horribly seven days later. Martin Henderson, David Dorfman, Brian Cox, Jane Alexander, Lindsay Frost, Amber Tamblyn(n)

programme.title: Enough
programme.desc: Screenwriter Nicholas Kazan and director Michael Apted combine elements of the hit films Sleeping With the Enemy and Double Jeopardy in this domestic thriller starring actress and recording artist Jennifer Lopez. "J. Lo" stars as Slim, a working-class diner waitress who accepts a date with the dashing Mitch (Bill Campbell), a successful building contractor who warns her about the insincere attentions of another suitor. Swept off her feet by Mitch, Slim soon marries him and gives birth to a daughter, Gracie (Tessa Allen). Her new life of suburban privilege seems idyllic for a few years until Slim discovers that Mitch is a serial philanderer. After his abuse becomes physical, Slim first seeks refuge with a battered woman's group then creates a new identity in another city, but she soon learns that there is no hiding from the resourceful Mitch, who is always able to track her down. After receiving little help from the father (Fred Ward), who abandoned her years ago, or the unsympathetic legal system, Slim resorts to martial arts lessons and a calculated campaign of payback designed to rid her and Gracie of the violent Mitch's presence forever. Enough co-stars Juliette Lewis, Noah Wyle, and Dan Futterman(n)

programme.title: The Purge: Election Year
programme.desc: In the third installment of this horror series about a night when all crime is legal, a former police sergeant who refused to murder his son's killer must now act as the head of security for a presidential candidate who wants to end "the Purge."(n)

programme.title: Trade
programme.desc: A powerful exposé of Mexico's sex-trafficking underworld, centering on the search for a 13-year-old girl who is abducted by Russian slave traders in Mexico City(n)

programme.title: Auto Focus
programme.desc: Biopic examining the sordid secret life of Bob Crane, popular star of the 1960s sitcom "Hogan's Heroes". Based on the book "The Murder of Bob Crane", by Robert Graysmith(n)

programme.title: The Flight of the Phoenix

programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate a state senator suspected of involvement in the disappearance of one of his aides. Award-winning police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin.(n)

programme.desc: Briscoe and Green believe the fatal stabbing of psychologist Tracy Conley may be linked to confidential client information on her computer. They learn one of the files on her hard drive has been tampered with since her death - information that would have ensured a known rapist spends another five years behind bars. Award-winning police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Natalia is arrested for the murder of her abusive ex-husband Nick Townsend, but the team is sidelined from the investigation by Internal Affairs, leaving it up to Horatio and Calleigh to prove her innocence. In a separate investigation, a wealthy single man is found dead in his mansion - and subsequent developments reveal the two cases are related.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part one of two. Ziva confronts her past when the team is ordered to protect her father, Mossad director Eli David, at a gathering of former heads of NCIS. Drama, guest starring TJ Ramini and Michael Nouri, with Cote de Pablo and Michael Weatherly.(n)

programme.title: Cedar Cove
programme.desc: Justine plans to surprise Seth with a warm welcome home from a fishing job in Alaska, but when he doesn't return as planned, she becomes concerned for his safety. Meanwhile, Jack informs Olivia that he has been offered a job that may take him out of town. Drama following the fortunes of Olivia Lockhart, a small-town judge, both inside and away from the courtroom.(n)

programme.title: Cedar Cove
programme.desc: Ex-con Larry, who was sentenced by Olivia and has served his time, arrives in town and asks her for the help he needs to get his life back on track. However, when the town's wooden pergola is set on fire, he becomes the chief suspect. Drama following the fortunes of a small-town judge, starring Andie MacDowell.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A former soldier comes to trial for the murder of a Yemeni immigrant he suspected of being a terrorist. Award-winning police drama, starring Sam Waterston.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the fatal shooting of two professors, which occurred soon after one of the academics campaigned against the treatment of women in the Middle East. Their inquiries lead them to a Muslim with strong beliefs - and an extreme dislike of females. Crime drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio and the team investigate the case of a Hollywood star whose body has been found in the boot of a car on a film set. Starring David Caruso.(n)

programme.desc: The agents investigate the murder of a marine during a cruise. His decision to change his will may have pushed one of his relatives to kill him to keep the firm in their control. Crime drama, guest-starring Diane Neal (Law & Order: Special Victims Unit).(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A navy recruitment officer is murdered at a high school and the agents discover he had recently begun a relationship with a married teacher whose wife held a grudge against him. Crime drama, guest starring comedian Bob Newhart.(n)

programme.desc: Gibbs is taken aback to discover Tony's father is linked to the team's latest investigation, a politically sensitive case involving an assassination attempt on Prince Sayif, a visiting Saudi dignitary with a taste for the high life. programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit

The prime suspect turns out to be a rival who was competing with the victim for a sponsorship deal, but finding him is no easy matter. Meanwhile, Stella tells Mac she thinks she is being stalked. Forensic drama, starring Gary Sinister, Eddie Cahill and Melina Kanakaredes.(n)

programme.title: Chicago PD
programme.desc: Notoriously dirty cop Hank Voight and his colleagues in the District 21 Intelligence Unit go on a quest to intercept a special consignment of ammunition before it hits the streets. His irreverent humour and madcap antics endear him to the grunts but bring him into direct conflict with his superiors. The film paints a broad picture of the conflict with Williams justifiably at centre stage in an achingly funny film(n)

programme.title: Ugly

programme.title: Black Mass

With his main competition out of the way, Bulger assumes power and becomes a feared crime boss(n)

programme.title: Magnum Force
programme.desc: The second action thriller in the Dirty Harry series sees maverick cop Harry Callahan investigating the slaying of some of the West Coast's most powerful criminals. Dismissing the theory that the murders are the result of underworld squabbling, Callahan learns that each of the victims was killed by a slug from a .357 Magnum - the most powerful handgun in the world, and a weapon widely used within the San Francisco Police Department(n)

programme.title: Manhunter
programme.desc: An FBI investigator pursues a deranged serial killer, nicknamed "The Tooth Fairy", with the help of his most prolific captured killer(n)

programme.title: The Fast and the Furious
programme.desc: Vin Diesel (Triple X) is Dominic Toretto, leader of a gang accused of stealing over a million dollars in electronic equipment. Packed with adrenaline, he makes a living transforming regular cars into powerful racing cars. With a stronghold on the streets of Los Angeles, nothing seems to stop him. Until a new King of Speed appears -undercover police officer Brian O'Conner, sent by the FBI to infiltrate the gang and find out who is responsible for the robberies. Quick and tough, Brian has enough experience and determination to become the winner on the roads. As he gains Dominic's confidence, he has everything to solve the case. In the process they become friends and Brian falls in love with Dominic's sister, Mia(n)

programme.title: Max Payne
programme.desc: Mark Wahlberg stars as a cop with vengeance on his mind in John Moore's video game-based CGI noir. The eponymous NYPD detective's (Wahlberg) life is torn apart by the brutal murder of his wife and child. Determined to track down those responsible and wreak bloody revenge, he leaves no stone unturned. His dedication pays off when investigating a tip-off about some drugs dealers. They put him on the trail of the manufacturers of a dangerous new hallucinogen that causes users to become both violent and fearless. But, just as he seems to be making progress, he finds himself prime suspect for a murder he did not commit..(n)

programme.title: The Enforcer
programme.desc: Clint Eastwood returns as Inspector "Dirty Harry" Callahan in this tale of an underground group terrorising San Francisco(n)

programme.title: Bug
programme.desc: William The Exorcist Friedkin's horror film stars Ashley Judd as Agnes, a waitress in a run-down bar who lives in a cheap motel. Into her life comes drifter Peter who, having served in the Gulf war, is obsessed with the idea that he is infected by bugs implanted by the government during medical treatment. She begins to share his paranoia and the pair spiral into a violent conspiracy theory which sees them become violently delusional to the point of extreme self-harm as they battle the bugs they believe are within them. Based on Tracy Letts' play from Chicago's Steppenwolf theatre, this is a visceral, frightening film but one that maintains an empathy for its characters up to the apocalyptic finale(n)

programme.title: Morgan

programme.desc: When he has a vision of his flight to Paris crashing, a teen travelling with his French club makes a scene and they are all kicked off the airline. The plane goes down and the survivors are grateful, but Death hunts them down(n)

programme.title: Hoosiers
programme.desc: A man gets a last-chance job coaching a small-town Indiana high-school basketball team and faces the dual challenge of bringing this underdog team to the 1951 state championship and redeeming himself from a mysterious past(n)

programme.title: Species: The Awakening
programme.desc: Miranda, a beautiful college professor, awakens from a blackout and is surrounded by dead bodies. She learns she is an alien/ human hybrid, and must travel to Mexico to find her creator before she can no longer contain her lethal urges(n)

programme.title: The Glimmer Man
programme.desc: Action thriller about a government agent who is asked to resume his old role as a police officer to help catch a serial killer preying on the citizens of LA. Teamed with a local homicide detective, the agent discovers that the killer seems to know a lot about his past(n)

programme.title: Jurassic World
programme.desc: Twenty-two years after Jurassic Park opened on Isla Nubar, a dinosaur-themed resort attracts thousands of visitors each year, just as John Hammond envisioned. However, following a bad sag in turnout a new effort is undertaken to revitalize Jurassic World, but once again mankind's attempts to interfere with nature bring ominous results(n)

programme.title: Species
programme.desc: Sci-fi thriller in which a young woman who is half-human, half-alien goes on the rampage. Scientists have received a message from space which details the DNA structure of the alien race which has sent it, together with instructions on how to combine the alien DNA with that of a human being. Now an experiment is underway to do just this - until the little girl at the heart of the experiment breaks out of the laboratory and goes on the run. Growing up at an incredible speed, Sil is also developing some quite alien powers and presents a serious threat to the human population. A team of trackers - and assassins - has been despatched to eliminate her, but will they succeed before it is too late?(n)

programme.title: The Strangers
programme.desc: Three masked intruders terrorise a young couple in a secluded country house(n)

programme.title: Stir of Echoes
programme.desc: Chilling mystery starring Kevin Bacon, based on a novel by cult author Richard Matheson. After being hypnotised, a man starts experiencing disturbing visions of a ghostly girl(n)

programme.title: The Maze Runner: The Scorch Trials
programme.desc: Thomas, Teresa, and the rest of the Gladers prepare for phase two of their maze trials after narrowly escaping the first test in this young-adult dystopian sequel(n)

programme.title: Minority Report
programme.desc: In the future, criminals are arrested before they have even committed their crime, thanks to the forecasting of 'pre-cogs'. Detective John Anderton thinks the system is perfect... until he's arrested. Brilliant sci-fi thriller based on a story by Philip K Dick(n)

programme.title: Daredevil
programme.desc: Mark Steven Johnson's violent superhero fantasy-morality play stars Ben Affleck as Matt Murdock, a guilt-wracked blind vigilante with a penchant for red leather. During his childhood, an accident involving toxic waste blinded Murdock, but it also enhanced his other senses and gave him a kind of 'radar vision'. The incident was partially caused by his discovery that his father was involved with the Mob. Now, the adult Murdock, spurred partly by Catholic guilt over his role in his father's death, has dedicated this life to fighting crime and protecting the innocent. By day Murdock's a defence lawyer, but by night he dispenses summary justice to criminals who've escaped the courts. Things get complicated when he falls in love with Elektra Natchios (Jennifer Garner). Not only is she the daughter of a man with connections to New York crime bosses but, unknown to Murdock, she's also a vigilante who's equally keen on figure-hugging leather (black in her case). And when Daredevil is framed for the murder of her father, Elektra swears vengeance on the masked crime-fighter (not realising that he's her lover). Meanwhile, both of them are in mortal danger from the actual killer, a merciless Irish assassin called Bullseye (Colin Farrell)(n)

programme.title: Ricochet
programme.desc: A cop receives lots of media attention when he nabs an infamous, sadistic killer at an amusement park. The murderer stews in jail for seven years, obsessively following the rising career of his arresting officer, who becomes a DA with a promising future, a husband, and a dad. This doesn't sit well with the vengeful convict, who after escaping from prison, puts into play a series of fiendish plots..(n)

programme.title: Pearl Harbor - The Heroes Who Fought Back

programme.title: World War II in Color
programme.desc: The Gathering Storm. Documentary telling the full story of World War II with the aid of rare and unseen archive footage, recently released official documents, modern colourisation techniques, state-of-the-art satellite-delivered terrain mapping and graphics. In the run-up to September 1939, political and economic chaos in the aftermath of World War I allowed Hitler in Germany, Mussolini in Italy and ultra-nationalists in imperial Japan to seize absolute power. When Britain, France and the United States failed to confront initial acts of aggression, contempt for their weakness prompted Germany and Italy to intervene in the civil war in Spain and Hitler to make a series of land grabs which brought Europe to the brink of war. Ep. 1 (Followed by News)(n)

programme.desc: Danny Sebastian and David Harper help the red and blue teams find bargains in the antiques shops of Dorking in Surrey, while host Anita Manning visits a Roman villa in West Sussex. Postponed from June 26.(n)

programme.title: The One Show

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Dot lies on the floor after her accident, unable to move and with no option but to wait for help. Derek remains on edge following Yolande's visit, not helped by an altercation with Keegan. Robbie leads a training day for the market traders, although Donna is far from impressed with his efforts. Shirley worries about Mick's wellbeing.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Jac buries herself in work, determined to save the life of a scared and fatalistic patient, while Sacha is forced to confront his faith when his mother sets him up on a blind date. Donna Jackson returns to Holby City, but clashes with Fletch's authority and questions whether too much has changed for her to simply pick up where she left off.(n)

programme.title: Broken
programme.desc: The arrival of Helen's brother Daniel immediately ruffles feathers when he gets into an argument with his sister's neighbour, Carl. Father Michael attempts to mediate, but when things escalate further, he's torn between doing what's right in the eyes of the law, and what he feels may resolve things between the two men without causing more upset to the grieving Helen. Elsewhere, Chloe Demichelis wants answers from the long suffering Michael. Drama, starring Sean Bean, Muna Otaru and Danny Sapani.(n)

programme.title: Doctor in the House
programme.desc: Dr Rangan Chatterjee visits Nicola, who has been diagnosed with 10 different conditions, including fibromyalgia, ME, sciatica and depression, and her pain and exhaustion has led her to become addicted to painkillers and virtually housebound. The doctor also spends time with Laverne, who is suffering from stress and severe exhaustion and is at risk of developing life-threatening type 2 diabetes. Rangan must find a way to completely overhaul her lifestyle, including her diet, sleeping habits and work-life balance. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Growing Up with Cancer
programme.desc: Documentary following the experiences of Natasha, Nairn and Declan as they receive treatment at the Teenage Cancer Trust Unit in Glasgow's Royal Hospital for Children, which offers special spaces for teen patients to listen to music, play video games or watch films with one another. Part of the Our Lives strand.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.desc: The team report live from Greater Manchester Fire and Rescue's training facility in Bury, and also meet the horses who help police officers in a variety of ways.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Lucy Alexander and Dion Dublin view a house in Kent, a former bar in Llanelli, south Wales and a terrace in Croydon before finding out who bought them and how much they sold for at auction.(n)

programme.title: A&E on the Road
programme.desc: The BASICS team treat two-year-old Ashanti, who has suffered a fit, while paramedic Kathryn Davies attends to a 15-year-old with Crohn's disease.(n)

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: A martial arts expert rescues a cop struggling with a bicycle thief, and a crook burgles a warehouse at Christmas but ends up leaving a present for the police.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: In Kingston upon Thames, south west London, two teams of mothers and sons are challenged to pick up bargains at an antiques fair. Antiques experts Jonathan Pratt and Kate Bliss are on hand to guide them towards turning a profit at auction as presenter Tim Wonnacott observes proceedings.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Ayesha takes Bren on a surprise trip, Rob tries to get to the bottom of a house burglary, and Valerie goes to see a ventriloquist performance.(n)

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts a game show in which contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single `impossible' answer knocking them out for the day.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps a couple aiming to find a comfortable country home in the East Midlands on a budget of £450,000, and visits the Leicester Line of the Grand Union Canal.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore unearths hidden gems at a recycling centre in Altrincham, including a collection of lab stools, an old electrical meter, and some worn fabric.(n)

programme.title: Street Auction
programme.desc: Paul Martin and Irina Aggrey visit Redruth to collect items to sell at a street auction in aid of a deserving local resident who works hard to help others despite her own problems.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Alex Jones host the live magazine show, with a team of roving reporters presenting stories of interest from around the UK, plus big-name studio guests.(n)

programme.title: Watchdog
programme.desc: New series. Matt Allwright, Steph McGovern and Nikki Fox return with a new series of topical reports and investigations, live from the programme's new home in Salford. In this episode, the hosts report on the alarming concerns surrounding smart meters in residential properties. Elsewhere, the team embark on an undercover investigation into a company that is training their new recruits to deliberately target elderly customers with products that they do not need, often costing thousands of pounds.(n)

programme.title: The Week the Landlords Moved In
programme.desc: A transformative series challenging some of Britain's most successful landlords to spend an eye-opening week living in one of their own rental properties. In the first episode, Essex-based landlords Marc and Peter are faced with some uncomfortable truths about the state of some of their rental properties, and self-made millionaire Paul experiences what it is like living in shared accommodation.(n)

programme.title: Room 101 - Extra Storage
programme.desc: Extended edition of the comedy panel show presented by Frank Skinner, with Lucy Porter, Romesh Ranganathan and Judge Robert Rinder competing to have their pet hates consigned to Room 101, with topics including lavish proposals, school reunions and New Year's Eve.(n)

programme.title: Supermarket Secrets
programme.desc: A look at how the retailers compete in the market for healthier foods. Gregg Wallace discovers how one supermarket is using an exotic ingredient to reduce salt in burgers and heads to Germany to find out whether a new innovation could deliver alcohol-free wine that still tastes good. Babita Sharma investigates the technology required to create a wheat and dairy-free version of one of the nation's favourite dishes and gets to the bottom of the confusing world of health labelling.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Model-turned-designer Jo Wood tells Brian Conley about her favourite old shows, recalling a spy thriller with a twist, a female comic with attitude and a TV chef in a ball gown.(n)

programme.title: A&E on the Road
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of the West Midlands Ambulance Service's mobile teams, who cover a catchment area with a population of nearly six million people.(n)

programme.title: The Super League Show
programme.desc: Tanya Arnold introduces the latest highlights including Leeds Rhinos v Castleford Tigers at Headingley and Hull FC v Wakefield Trinity at the KCOM Stadium.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: The Isle of Sheppey.
programme.desc: New series. Nick Knowles travels to the Isle of Sheppey in Kent to meet two extraordinary dads, Garry and Kyle, who have adopted four vulnerable children - three of whom have special needs - to give them the best life possible. But their cramped three-bedroom bungalow is making family life difficult. So to give this family the space they so desperately need, the DIY SOS builders are undertaking their most ambitious project yet - to demolish the bungalow and build a bespoke five-bedroom house in its place. But with just nine days to complete the task, it looks like being their toughest one yet.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country. Presented by Jo Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Tennis from Eastbourne
programme.desc: The AEGON International. John Inverdale presents coverage of day two from the Devonshire Park Lawn Tennis Club in Eastbourne, featuring the second-round matches. Three of the top four seeds fell at this stage last year, with Roberta Vinci, Belinda Bencic and Timea Bacsinszky losing to Ekaterina Makarova, Elena Vesnina and Kristina Mladenovic respectively. With commentary by Sam Smith and Gigi Salmon. Coverage continues on the interactive service.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Philip Serrell and Caroline Hawley find maritime antiques to take to auction in Falmouth, including a Rolex watch with a James Bond connection.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Jeremy Vine, in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Curious Creatures
programme.desc: Kate Humble hosts the panel show that tests the wildlife knowledge of captains Chris Packham, Lucy Cooke and guests Steve Backshall and Ajay Tegala in a variety of rounds.(n)

programme.title: The World's Most Extraordinary Homes
programme.desc: Architect Piers Taylor and property enthusiast Caroline Quentin explore unusual homes built in mountainous regions. They begin in California, viewing a property built from the wings and tail fins of a Boeing 747. In Arizona, the pair stay in a modern house with an innovative take on an ancient technique of absorbing the heat during the day and releasing it at night. In New Zealand, Caroline and Piers view a house camouflaged using cedar cladding, while their last stop takes them to an hexagonal alpine chalet with a steel chimney core that anchors it to the mountain.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.sub-title: Great British Menu: The Finals: Final Fish.
programme.desc: The eight regional champions cook their seafood courses, but with some high scoring dishes in the regional heats each chef will need to deliver perfection to see off the competition. Experts Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort and Andi Oliver are joined by guest judge Tim Henman, former British Number One, who competed in Wimbledon's semi-final on four separate occasions.(n)

programme.title: Hospital
programme.desc: Cameras follow Glendon from Preston who has Glioblastoma, a form of brain tumour. He has identified an immunotherapy drug, and wants to self-fund a course, so he seeks advice at Charing Cross Hospital's private wing. Elsewhere in London, Nicky from Devon has travelled to Queen Charlotte's and Chelsea Hospital to receive NHS treatment not available at her local hospital for her ovarian cancer.(n)

programme.title: Detectorists
programme.desc: New series. The return of Mackenzie Crook's award-winning comedy in which he and Toby Jones star as metal detector enthusiasts in search of their hearts' desire. Andy is considering internet dating. Not for him, but for Lance, who is still not over the departure of his ex-wife. Meanwhile, a mysterious stranger arrives to tempt the metal detecting club - in more ways than one. Real-life mother and daughter Diana Rigg and Rachael Stirling co-star, with Gerard Horan and Sophie Thompson.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Horizon: 10 Things You Need to Know About the Future.
programme.desc: Mathematician Hannah Fry is joined by a selection of BBC science experts to investigate the British public's questions about the future, trying to discover whether people could live for ever and if there will be a cure for cancer. Hannah examines the future of transport and if it will be possible to ditch fossil fuels, looks at what the weather will be like and discovers if the planet is on the verge of another mass extinction.(n)

programme.title: The Life Swap Adventure
programme.desc: A hunter from the Amazon rainforest trades places with a civil servant in London, as the adventure travelogue continues. Guyanese Lionel, who has lived as part of the self-sustaining Machousi tribe, learns that a life of comfort in the British capital comes at a cost that many are unable to afford, and plans to communicate this to his city-obsessed children back home. Meanwhile, civil servant John discovers the essential value of community as he visits Lionel's village Surama, where the arrival of money and capitalism threaten to end a way of life that has survived for centuries.(n)

programme.title: Doctor in the House
programme.desc: Rangan Chatterjee spends time with 11-year-old Kiki, who is 11st and at risk of diabetes despite having a healthy diet and being one of the sportiest kids at school. The doctor must discover why the boy can't lose weight and come up with a solution quickly to keep school bullies at bay. Rangan also helps 16-year-old Hoshi-Rae, who has an eating disorder and the consequent health issues are seriously affecting her teenage years. Is the key to her problems her Mum, Lisa, who has a history of bulimia?.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Linford Christie joins comedy star Brian Conley for a nostalgic look at the archive television that helped set him on the path to success as an Olympic sprinter, from the crazy kicks and amazing flicks of 1970s wrestling to the antics of Bob and Terry in The Likely Lads, via the world's first superstar footballer on and off the small screen.(n)

programme.title: A&E on the Road

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The programme celebrates its 50th anniversary at Gardeners' World Live at Birmingham's NEC. Joe Swift and Adam Frost explore the show gardens and meet a designer who has created a garden showcasing 50 years of changing trends. Carol Klein looks at the plants that have defined the decades, while Rachel de Thame, Flo Headlam, Alan Power, Nick Bailey and Mark Lane explore other features of the event. Main host Monty Don catches up with predecessor Alan Titchmarsh to discuss the series, while Mary Berry reveals the winner of the golden jubilee plant award.(n)

With commentary by Sam Smith and Gigi Salmon. Coverage continues on the interactive service.(n)

programme.desc: Experts Thomas Plant and David Fletcher select items to take to auction, including a masonic watch and a sought after commemorative mug by Eric Ravilious. Plus, presenter Paul Martin visits the home of Britain's first Prime Minister, Robert Walpole.(n)

programme.title: The World's Most Extraordinary Homes
programme.desc: Architect Piers Taylor and actress Caroline Quentin explore unusual homes built in or near areas of forest. After trips to properties near Madrid and the Catskill Mountains in New York State, they arrive in Piha, New Zealand, to a house built within an indigenous forest of pohutukawa trees. Navigating very strict environmental laws, this wooden-cladded and glass-roofed property mimics the branches of the surrounding trees, while its huge sliding glass walls open up to allow the surrounding forest to become an intrinsic part of the house itself.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.sub-title: Great British Menu: The Finals: Finals Main.
programme.desc: The finalists prepare their main courses, hoping to impress with some new and untested dishes. Judges Matthew Fort, Andi Oliver and Oliver Peyton are joined by guest judge Gordon Reid, Paralympic gold medallist and winner of the first ever men's singles wheelchair event at Wimbledon, as they decide who has done enough to take their main course to the banquet.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Natural World: Sudan: The Last of the Rhinos.
programme.desc: The remarkable story of Sudan, the very last male northern white rhino on the planet. Snatched from his mother's side in Central Africa, Sudan became a prized exhibit in a zoo while the rest of his kind were poached to near-extinction. This programme focuses on the desperate battle to bring his sub-species back from the brink of extinction, told through the characters who have been involved in his life.(n)

programme.title: White Gold
programme.desc: In a bid to get back everything he has lost, his marriage, his livelihood and self-worth, Vincent concocts a spectacular plot to return to his rightful place, with the help of local gangster, Ronnie Farrell. But before that, he has to pay off his massive tax bill. Meanwhile, when Carol makes a simple mistake, Fitzpatrick and Lavender must help save the day. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Hospital
programme.desc: Cameras follow Glendon from Preston who has Glioblastoma, a form of brain tumour. He has identified an immunotherapy drug, and wants to self-fund a course, so he seeks advice at Charing Cross Hospital's private wing. Elsewhere in London, Nicky from Devon has travelled to Queen Charlotte's and Chelsea Hospital to receive NHS treatment not available at her local hospital for her ovarian cancer.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo sets off from Newcastle on the final leg of his journey from Derby to Lindisfarne, finding out about the world's earliest swing bridge and its inventor William Armstrong. He also travels by boat from the port of Seahouses to examine the story of lighthouse keeper's daughter Grace Darling, who, along with her father, rescued nine people from tumultuous seas in 1838. On the Holy Island of Lindisfarne, Michael explores the lime kilns and finds out how Christianity spread from here across northern England in the 7th century.(n)

programme.title: Pain, Pus & Poison: The Search for Modern Medicines
programme.desc: Dr Michael Mosley's three-part documentary exploring the history of medicine concludes as he tells the story of how scientists went from finding antidotes to poisons to applying otherwise dangerous toxins as a cure. He reveals why he believes, of all the natural remedies featured in his scientific tour, the tales of treatments derived from deadly substances are perhaps the most extraordinary he encountered. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Hokusai: Old Man Crazy to Paint
programme.desc: Biography of the world-renowned Japanese artist Katsushika Hokusai, whose print The Great Wave off Kanagawa helped make his name. With Andy Serkis reading the voice of Hokusai, the film features artists David Hockney and Maggi Hambling, and scholars who study, admire and venerate this Japanese master.(n)

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: With girl bands and pop music permeating Japanese life, cameras follow the cultural phenomenon driven by an obsession with young female sexuality and internet popularity.(n)

programme.title: Who Should We Let In? Ian Hislop on the First Great Immigration Row
programme.desc: As Brexit Britain prepares to draw up new rules on who is welcome in the UK, Ian Hislop explores the decades from the Victorian era to the First World War, when modern Britain introduced its first peacetime restrictions on immigration. Until then, the Victorians had an open door to foreigners, but rising numbers in the late 19th-century triggered a fierce disagreement over who should be allowed in, mirroring the ongoing modern-day debate.(n)

programme.title: Majesty and Mortar: Britain's Great Palaces
programme.desc: Dan Cruickshank reflects on the period just prior to the First World War, when the redesign of Buckingham Palace and the Mall took place. He also considers the challenges faced by the nation's palaces during the interwar years and their restoration and conservation in more recent times. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Treasure Hunters
programme.desc: The second of two programme focuses on man-made treasures. Dallas Campbell dives to a shipwreck where 5,000 emeralds have been found, hunts for a treasure chest hidden in the Rocky Mountains and comes face to face with China's Terracotta Army. Ellie Harrison enters a jewelled room in Russia decorated with millions of pounds' worth of amber, meets diamond-cutters who know a single slip of the hand could be costly and travels to Egypt, where she stares at Tutankhamun's death mask, one of the most famous golden images on the planet.(n)

programme.title: Pain, Pus & Poison: The Search for Modern Medicines
programme.desc: Dr Michael Mosley's three-part documentary exploring the history of medicine concludes as he tells the story of how scientists went from finding antidotes to poisons to applying otherwise dangerous toxins as a cure. He reveals why he believes, of all the natural remedies featured in his scientific tour, the tales of treatments derived from deadly substances are perhaps the most extraordinary he encountered. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Hokusai: Old Man Crazy to Paint
programme.desc: Biography of the world-renowned Japanese artist Katsushika Hokusai, whose print The Great Wave off Kanagawa helped make his name. With Andy Serkis reading the voice of Hokusai, the film features artists David Hockney and Maggi Hambling, and scholars who study, admire and venerate this Japanese master.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on a new journey following his Bradshaw's handbook from south-west Wales to Cambridge, beginning in Pembroke Dock, where Queen Victoria's royal yachts were built. In the little market town of Naberth he investigates what caused rebels to dress up as women, later spending the night at an inn in Carmarthen where Horatio Nelson once met Emma Hamilton. Next day, the former politician pitches in with the volunteers who look after the Gwili Heritage line and ends his leg in Swansea, where he learns how to pose for a photograph in Victorian style.(n)

programme.title: Sound of Cinema: The Music That Made the Movies
programme.desc: Neil Brand explores what makes a great film soundtrack, and reveals that in the second half of the 20th century composers embraced jazz, pop and rock to bring new energy to movie scores. Using the 1960s as an example, he shows how the James Bond features, Italy's spaghetti westerns and Disney's musicals utilised the talents of composers such as John Barry and Ennio Morricone, before the role of a composer changed when directors like Martin Scorsese began to employ carefully chosen pop songs. With contributions from Richard Sherman, Lalo Schifrin and David Arnold.(n)

programme.title: Spies of Warsaw
programme.desc: Part one of two. Dick Clement and Ian La Frenais' adaptation of Alan Furst's spy novel set in Poland, Paris, London and Berlin in the years leading up to the Second World War. It is 1937 and at the French embassy in Warsaw, new military attache Colonel Jean-Francois Mercier is drawn into a world of abduction, betrayal and intrigue in the diplomatic salons and back alleys of the city. At the same time, the handsome aristocrat finds himself in a passionate love affair with Anna, a Parisian lawyer for the League of Nations. Their complicated liaison intensifies as German tanks drive through the Black Forest. Starring David Tennant and Janet Montgomery.(n)

programme.title: The Flying Scotsman: A Rail Romance
programme.desc: To celebrate its 90th birthday, Barbara Flynn narrates the story of the nation's love affair with the Flying Scotsman - arguably the most famous locomotive in the world, and one that symbolises all that was great about British engineering. In 2004, public donations and grants were used to purchase the train and keep it in Britain, where the National Railway Museum has been working to restore it to its former glory. First shown in 2013.(n)

programme.title: Andrew Marr on Churchill: Blood, Sweat and Oil Paint
programme.desc: The broadcaster investigates Winston Churchill's lifelong love for painting and reveals the ways in which his hobby helped shape his career as politician and statesman. Andrew travels to the south of France and Morocco to discovers how the former PM's serious approach to the craft of led to friendships with major British artists of the 20th century, and he finds out how a single painting may have influenced the course of the Second World War.(n)

programme.desc: Di learns her ruse to get pregnant has had a rather unpleasant side effect, and when her husband learns the truth, it becomes clear she has got a lot of explaining to do. Julie S begins the slow process of recovery after her mastectomy, while Fenner takes advantage of Tina's increasing isolation, and Yvonne's feelings for Colin grow. Snowball continues to yearn for death in the aftermath of Ritchie's suicide, sliding into a downward spiral of starvation and self-mutilation, despite Karen's best efforts to help her.(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 407. An emotional pitch is given by a stylist from Santa Monica, Cal., who started her own slip business; a man from Folcroft, Pa., explains why his scrubbing tool makes cleaning easier; a Denver couple try to sell the panel on their frozen yogurt for dogs; and a duo from Camas, Wash., demonstrate their hands-free, electric unicycle. Also: an update on a Season 3 drinking cup invested in by Robert and Mark(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 606. The Sharks consider a business idea for affordable wedding cakes brought to them by a mother and son from Grand Rapids, Mich. Also: a Houston restaurateur with a solution to a common problem encountered while dining out; and an update on a screen repair fix-it kit that Lori invested in during Season 5(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 704. Self-made billionaire Chris Sacca joins the Sharks and ends up in a battle with Lori Greiner over a tech education business started by two sisters from Pomona, Cal. Also: Chicago sports fans pitch a specialized version of a popular home rental Web site; an entrepreneur reveals a unique twist on a popular hot drink; an inventor from Portland, Ore., has a device that can inflate objects in mere seconds; and a Houston woman offers an update after not securing a deal for her loofah soap company(n)

programme.title: The Profit

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 614. Products for the holidays are featured, including a stamping kit that proves Santa made a visit. Also: a book and plush toy designed to become a Jewish tradition; an easier way to handle the storage and display of Christmas lights; a 13-year-old girl's device to ease muscle pain; and an update on a Hanukkah tree topper invested in by Daymond John during Season 5(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 521. Mark Cuban gives a mechanical engineer from San Francisco a tongue-lashing; and parents from Los Angeles pitch babywear that's designed to help caregivers keep track of busy crawlers. programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Karen and Jack conspire to sort out Will and Grace's differences over parenting by getting them to attend the birthday party Joe and Larry are throwing for their daughter. Eric McCormack and Debra Messing star.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Amy invites her brother for dinner, but he ends up outstaying his welcome, forcing Robert to take desperate measures to eject him from the couch. Comedy, starring Ray Romano.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray and Debra begin telling lies in a bid to cover up previous falsehoods, but Marie soon suspects what they are doing. American comedy, starring Ray Romano, Patricia Heaton and Doris Roberts.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Domestic disharmony causes chaos in Frasier's apartment, leaving Martin's beloved chair ruined and the carpet soiled. Meanwhile, Roz begins piano lessons. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer, John Mahoney and Jane Leeves.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The Seattle shrink celebrates his 2,000th radio broadcast and is disappointed to find he has a recording of every show but one, forcing him to turn to an obsessive fan for a copy of the elusive tape. Guest starring computer tycoon Bill Gates.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles and Frasier befriend Kirby, whose girlfriend's grandfather is a well-known wine connoisseur. Martin is forced to wear a device to monitor his blood pressure. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: First of a two-part special in which Gordon Ramsay heads to the Burger Kitchen in Los Angeles, where tensions are running high because owner Alan Saffron has spent his son's entire inheritance on the struggling restaurant. To make matters worse, the kitchen is run by a chef called David Blaine who shares nothing of his famous namesake's magic when it comes to cooking - and whose threatening behaviour regularly gets him into trouble.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Liverpool couple John and Pauline McDonough both have demanding jobs in the pharmaceutical industry and want to find a relaxing bolt-hole to escape to in Spain's Granada province. Laura Hamilton shows them five properties starting at just under £86,000 in the hope that they will make an offer.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Stable-owner Alice and her boyfriend Ollie, travel specialists Gareth and Hihine, and newlyweds John and Katy compete over three evenings in Cambridge to host the best dinner party.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: At Pickwick Pawnbrokers in London, Nathan and his sidekick Debbs seal the deals on an unusual life-size Majolica lion, a rare book, and racing silks owned by jockey AP McCoy. Meanwhile, at Dan's London Road Shop in Sheffield, the team values a selection of high-end rubies and an unusual astronaut jukebox.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley host as contestants pit their wits against vowels, consonants and numbers. Colin Murray is in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent.(n)

programme.title: Fifteen to One
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the general knowledge quiz in which 15 contestants try to win a place in the end-of-series final, when a £40,000 jackpot will be up for grabs.(n)

programme.title: Best of Both Worlds
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander helps Edinburgh's Lisa and Fiona find a home near to open spaces, and Chichester couple Charlotte and Sam, who are looking to buy their first property together.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Forest Country House in Powys, Wales, where owner Paul Martin, joined by best friend and neighbour, Jayne Kirk, hopes his luxury B&B will impress.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the second night from Essex/Suffolk, and it is the turn of salon owner Sam to cook. She has opted for a good looking, simple menu, but foodie Chris is not impressed.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer is duped into enlisting in the army, and falls foul of a hard-nosed officer who uses him as the target in a training exercise. Escaping back to Springfield with troops in hot pursuit, he makes his way home - where Marge's ingenuity saves the day. With the guest voice of Kiefer Sutherland.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: A new face arrives in Hollyoaks village, while Hunter turns to Lily for help, and Yasmine tricks Kim. Elsewhere, Shane manipulates Cleo to withdraw Goldie's saving account after stealing her bank card.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Tried and Tasted: The Ultimate Shopping List
programme.desc: Joining chef Michel Roux Jr around the tasting table this time are First Dates' Fred Sirieix, food critic Giles Coren, baker and deli owner Stacie Stewart and TV presenter Lucy Alexander. The panel choose between four different brands of smoked salmon, gin and the ready meal favourite lasagne. Plus, the quick-fire public taste test samples milk chocolate, something Brits spend around a billion pounds on each year.(n)

programme.title: Supershoppers
programme.desc: Anna Richardson and Andi Osho reveal which chocolates and biscuit brands to avoid when it comes to price. They look at how much it really costs to get a `free' coffee from the nation's biggest chains. The team also investigates travel insurance, and the high cost of West End theatre tickets.(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Exploring life at Liverpool Women's Hospital through the eyes of male midwife Chris, a former navy trauma medic. Cameras also follow 22-year-old Kiefer, the birthing partner for his girlfriend Sophie. Following life-threatening complications during the birth of their first child, can he hold it together this time?.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: `Deadly' (aka David) found fame with his UK garage crew, and though he may be confident on stage, he's shy and retiring with the ladies. Can he bring his A-game when he meet teaching assistant Helen? Other diners include rock fan Anthony, who meets retired nurse and fellow northerner Barbara. She's an amateur magician with a few dating tricks up her sleeve.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Doctors treat a young woman who has been thrown from a horse, which then trampled on her, and also a woman who was hit by a car while riding her motorbike on a dual carriageway. Plus, an 11-year-old boy is brought into hospital after running into a wall at school and hurting his wrist.(n)

programme.title: Four to the Floor
programme.desc: David Vujanic, Madam X and Thris Tian welcome J Hus, Moses Boyd and Shy FX. Plus, DJs Fabio and Grooverider discuss the roots of jungle music, and Nick Marston provides the comedy.(n)

programme.title: The World's Weirdest Weather
programme.desc: A visit to a town in South Carolina where it's raining popcorn-like snow - actually little balls of ice called graupel that appear harmless but could trigger avalanches. Storm chaser Geoff Mackley films a dangerous concoction of volcanic ash, rocks, debris and water called lahar, and a man in Newfoundland records footage of a strange, rolling bank of fog that looks like a tsunami. In Canberra, there's a giant tornado born not from a thundercloud but from a colossal firestorm, while in the Peak District, strong winds defy gravity - blowing a waterfall upwards.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Great Gay Buildings
programme.desc: Stephen Fry is joined by seven fellow celebrities to mark the 50th anniversary of the 1967 Sexual Offences Act, which decriminalised private homosexual acts between men. The group explores the histories of several buildings that became cornerstones in the battle for gay rights in the UK. The Rev Richard Coles revisits the hedonistic past of London's Heaven Nightclub, while Mary Portas visits Shibden Hall near Halifax to celebrate the life of 19th-century lesbian heiress Anne Lister. Craig Revel Horwood investigates Britain's drag scene at the Royal Vauxhall Tavern, and Simon Callow tells the story of Oscar Wilde's downfall at the Old Bailey. Plus, Rikki Beadle-Blair visit the Theatre Royal Haymarket to remember how the British public showed their support for John Gielgud after he was arrested for cottaging, and Liz Carr takes in Bletchley Park, the one-time home of Alan Turing. Finally, Waheed Alli tells the story of recent battles for gay right in the Houses of Parliament.(n)

programme.title: Conviction
programme.desc: A single mother stands by her brother when he is convicted of a murder he swears he did not commit. Despite having little education, she works hard to fund putting herself through law school so she can use her skills to overturn the conviction, ultimately attracting the attention of a high-profile attorney. Fact-based drama, starring Hilary Swank, Sam Rockwell and Minnie Driver.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: The property experts head to London, where Phil Spencer helps first-time buyers Jo and Pete, who are looking for a place together in the areas of Archway and Holloway for around £400,000. Meanwhile, in West Hampstead, Kirstie Allsopp seeks out a family home for Tham and Krish that falls into the preferred school-catchment area for their daughter.(n)

programme.title: Fifteen to One
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the general knowledge quiz in which 15 contestants try to win a place in the end-of-series final, when a £40,000 jackpot will be up for grabs.(n)

programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with sports presenter Colin Murray joining Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.sub-title: It's the Gay Pumpkin, Charlie Brown.
programme.desc: Will is reluctantly dragged along with Grace and her new boyfriend Leo for a cycle ride in search of Hallowe'en pumpkins. Meanwhile, Jack and Karen attend a therapy session designed to `cure' gay men and women.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Will has cause to rue the day his firm's long-absent senior partner returns. Meanwhile, Karen ends up living in her limo after becoming estranged from Stan. Guest starring Gene Wilder.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra realises Ray is planning something for her birthday and suggests having a Chinese banquet, but her mother has already started organising an old-fashioned English tea party. Katherine Helmond guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: The Barones spend Thanksgiving with Amy's parents, but the festivities get off to a bad start by her father's drastic response to the plight of an injured bird. Things liven up when the two families split into teams of Native Americans and Pilgrims to mark the national holiday. Comedy, starring Brad Garrett and Monica Horan.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The Seattle shrink's agent Bebe puts her lowly assistant in charge of his career when a hot new radio psychiatrist appears on the scene. Meanwhile, Martin seems unwilling to make a doctor's appointment. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and John Mahoney.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Roz tries everyone's patience by talking incessantly about her new love Roger, and Frasier offers to help protect Martin from a bullying boss. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and John Mahoney.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Part one of two. Peace and harmony are shattered by the arrival of Daphne's conniving mother and lecherous brother, and Frasier finds himself forced into playing host. Comedy, guest starring Anthony LaPaglia and Millicent Martin, with Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Part two of two. The chef continues his quest to transform the fortunes of the Burger Kitchen in Los Angeles, where tensions were running high because owner Alan Saffron had spent his son's entire inheritance on the struggling restaurant. Alan gets a wake-up call from internet critics, who he believes are trying to shut him down.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps married couple Ali and Ben Brown from Kent find their ideal property abroad, as she shows them five places on the Spanish island of Gran Canaria.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In East Anglia, hip-hop enthusiasts Christine and Terry provide a hearty menu for their guests, before allotment owners Tim and Amanda host with a menu dedicated to their home-grown fruit and veg. Finally, Megan and Matt - who rarely spend time together in the kitchen - set off their fire alarm and have difficulty pulling things together and getting any food to the table.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Dan makes an offer on Susannah's silver tea set, and Ada's large bronze sculpture leaves him stumped. Meanwhile, at Nikolas Patrick pawnbrokers in Kent, owner Charlie finalises deals on an antique writing bureau and a diamond ring.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with Colin Murray in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent.(n)

programme.title: Fifteen to One

programme.title: Best of Both Worlds
programme.desc: A cosmetic tattooist from Hampshire searches for a home in the country with city connections, and Janet and Ron look to retire from London near their grandchildren in Hertfordshire.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week takes place at the Langside Bed and Breakfast in Fenwick, Scotland, where super-clean hosts Debbie and Jim McCalliog hope to wow their guests.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Claire hosts the third night of the contest in Essex, and lays on a lavish East End-themed feast, but Sam may be looking for vengeance after everyone claimed her food was boring.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: Ice-Cream of Margie (With the Light Blue Hair).
programme.desc: Homer is fired from the power plant and secures a job as an ice-cream man, but gets so wrapped up in his new career that he puts his marriage in jeopardy. Meanwhile, Marge discovers a new skill as an expert sculptor, using an unusual medium - lollipop sticks.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Cindy and Holly have some mother and daughter time, while Louis comforts Simone when she tells him that her mum is dying of Cancer. Elsewhere, Prince has his eyes on the prize, and Kim is feeling lost.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Ackley Bridge
programme.desc: Missy suffers a traumatic discovery regarding Nana Booth, and fearing that social services will take Haley into care, she keeps everything a secret until she forced to ask Emma for help with money. Meanwhile, Nas is left feeling heartbroken when her relationship with Lila starts to hit rocky ground, and Kaneez realises she has to alert Mandy about the Booth girls when she gets caught in a fight between Simone and Missy. School drama series, starring Jo Joyner, Paul Nicholls and Sunetra Sarker.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: An 18-year-old is rushed in after breaking his leg while playing football, and doctors worry it may have long-term implications. Meanwhile, David, who is 29, is airlifted to St George's following a head-on collision at speed, and 94-year-old Mary arrives after falling backwards down 14 steps and losing consciousness.(n)

programme.title: Fargo
programme.desc: Gloria and Winnie start connecting the dots. Meanwhile, Nikki and Ray's retaliation has consequences for Emmit. Starring Ewan McGregor, Carrie Coon, Mary Elizabeth Winstead and David Thewlis.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: This edition follows the case of a man who was attacked and left unconscious on the floor of a crowded pub for more than 30 minutes, but no-one is prepared to come forward and name the assailant. The next day, detectives from Bedfordshire Police seize CCTV footage from the pub and though they can clearly see the vicious assault, they are unable to easily identify who threw the punches. Cameras follow every twist and turn of the investigation as the officers try to overcome the wall of silence they face.(n)

programme.title: The Mr Men Show
programme.desc: Mr Rude buys a new toothbrush, Mr Grumpy's house is invaded by Miss Sunshine and her friends, and Miss Whoops tries to clean Mr Quiet's teeth.(n)

programme.title: Mofy
programme.desc: The Mice children send a letter to Mofy telling her that their mother is not feeling very well and they would like the rabbit to visit to cheer her up.(n)

programme.title: Fatal Justice
programme.desc: A woman shopping in a convenience store witnesses a robbery in which the owner was killed and her niece seriously injured, ending up a paraplegic. The shopper, Karen, believes she recognises one of the robbers, but he is released thanks to a false alibi. Tortured by the memories of the murder of her brother - a crime that was never solved - Karen embarks on a trail of revenge against the perpetrators. Drama, starring Cynthia Watros.
