programme.title: Britain's Greatest Bridges
programme.desc: For years, London's East End was denied a new bridge because of the need to guarantee passage of ships up and down the Thames. For years, the greatest engineers of the age hunted for a design that would keep both road and water traffic moving. As Rob Bell explains, the solution came from architect Horace Jones, whose revolutionary design, with its thousand-tonne opening sections, was powered by nothing more than water. Rob also explains the bridge was lucky to survive the Second World War, having been a target for German V-1 flying bombs.(n)

programme.title: The Dog Rescuers with Alan Davies
programme.desc: As the strand returns, RSPCA officer Anthony helps Timmy, a neglected elderly collie cross who is found in a house surrounded by his own mess with a huge tumour on his face. Meanwhile, Inspector Helen meets Archie, a stroppy shih-tzu whose fur is so matted he can barely see or hear.(n)

programme.title: The Hotel Inspector
programme.desc: Alex Polizzi returns to help a couple with their beach-front business in the Merseyside resort of Southport. John and Mel opened a craft ale bar and started renovating the flats above it into a hostelry despite having no experience. With the residence more of a building site than a boutique hotel, Alex has to get stuck in as the first guests are due in a matter of weeks.(n)

programme.desc: Documentary profiling a selection of pensioners who are determined to grow old disgracefully. Among those highlighted are fame-hungry 62-year-old Jane Buckle from Hungerford, who is on a mission to become as famous as Beyonce by performing a `granny rap' with Wu Tang Clan, and Brighton resident Lynn Ruth Miller, who - at 82 years of age - is thought to be the world's oldest burlesque artist. In Manchester, 72-year-old triple divorcee Sophia is on the hunt for a toy-boy, and Cambridge punk-granny Annalisa refuses to let approaching her 90th year slow her down.(n)

programme.title: SuperCasino
programme.desc: Viewers get the chance to take part in live interactive gaming, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Benefits Handout
programme.desc: Tony and Diane realise that starting a second-hand business is not going to be as easy as they thought, while Scott is eagerly buying up stock for his party business and heads to a pet shop on the hunt for exotic animals. Rachel decides to pay six months' rent up front, and for the first time in her life experiences what it is like to be debt-free.(n)

programme.title: Never Teach Your Wife to Drive
programme.desc: Documentary following three women who are learning how to drive under instruction from their partners, with the drama and mayhem of the lessons putting added strain on their relationships. In Hertfordshire, Becky's tendency to put her foot down on the accelerator and severe lack of spatial awareness leaves Greg stressed out, while John begins by taking Yasmin out for endless spins around a car park in Wigan. In Guisborough, North Yorkshire, Matt's high levels of patience are tested as he teaches his hot-tempered wife Yaveli the rules of the road.(n)

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Property expert Ann Maurice offers advice to the owner of a three-bedroom Victorian house in north London's highly desirable Camden area. The garish hall is a definite turn-off, so she decides on a more neutral colour scheme and rejuvenates the roof terrace with plants and accessories.(n)

programme.title: The Nightmare Neighbour Next Door
programme.desc: The story of Gary, a self-styled community crusader who was unhappy when his neighbour erected a high fence without permission, so he turned his front yard into a bizarre spectacle of bright lights, signs, banners and soft toys to highlight his concerns. Plus, a woman whose quiet life was disrupted when a couple and their nine children moved in nearby, and a man and wife who angered their community by breaking the local parking rules.(n)

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.sub-title: GPs Behind Closed Doors: Best of Patient Files.
programme.desc: A man battling with cancer reflects on his progress, after admitting to doctors he would rather take his own life than endure a long decline. Meanwhile, a young man suffering from the rare Guillain-Barre syndrome discusses dealing with the debilitating condition, and a young woman who suffered a severe panic attack talks about her ongoing battle with mental illness.(n)

programme.title: Where There's Blame, There's a Claim
programme.desc: A three-part series revealing the stories behind compensation claims for injuries in the UK, from theme park disasters to botched plastic surgery. The first episode focuses on Leah Washington and Joe Pugh, whose lives were turned upside down then when the roller coaster ride they were on crashed into an empty carriage, leaving the pair with devastating life changing injuries.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother
programme.desc: Daily round-up of highlights, revealing how the housemates are getting on under the all-seeing eye of Big Brother, featuring the latest tasks, games, arguments, laughs, diary room visits and bedroom chit-chat. Narrated by Marcus Bentley.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother's Bit on the Side
programme.desc: Rylan Clark-Neal presents the BB companion show, including celebrity fans' thoughts on the latest developments in the run-up to tomorrow's eviction and behind-the-scenes insights.(n)

programme.title: 2 Fast 2 Furious
programme.desc: Former LA cop Brian now makes his living driving in illegal street races in Miami. Squeezed by the FBI, he agrees to set up druglord Verone for a king-sized bust(n)

programme.title: Maximum Overdrive
programme.desc: The Rhea-M comet starts revolving round earth and provokes all machinery to become their own masters and revolt against mankind. The Rhea-M comet starts revolving round earth and provokes all machinery to become their own masters and revolt against mankind. A group of people find shelter in a relay station and are surrounded by a horde of raging trucks. After a tremendous fight. Bill, Bubba, Brett and some others manage to reach the coast and set sail to an island void of technology(n)

programme.title: Doctor Detroit
programme.desc: After a night of partying, Clifford, a timid professor, is duped into posing as a flamboyant pimp. Balancing his educator life and street life, Clifford must manage four prostitutes and save them from an intimidating mob boss named Mom(n)

programme.title: Consenting Adults
programme.desc: Composer Richard Parker (Kevin Kline) and his wife Priscilla (Mary Elizabeth Mastrantonio) live an ordinary suburban life until they meet their new neighbors Eddy (Kevin Spacey) and Kay (Rebecca Miller). The two couples become friends until some mate-swapping is suggested by the men. The plot takes a nasty turn, however, when Richard sleeps with Kay -- who turns up, the next morning, bludgeoned to death with a baseball bat. Soon, Richard is charged with the crime and must prove his innocence(n)

programme.title: Dirty Harry
programme.desc: Director: Don Siegel. When a mad man calling himself 'the Scorpio Killer' menaces the city, tough as nails San Francisco Police Inspector Harry Callahan is assigned to track down and ferret out the crazed psychopath(n)

programme.title: Wanted
programme.desc: A wimpy account manager (James McAvoy) is recruited by a sexy mystery woman (Angelina Jolie) to join a secret society of assassins and avenge the murder of his estranged father. Morgan Freeman costars in this non-stop action thrill ride. Directed by Timur Bekmambetov(n)

programme.title: Shattered Glass
programme.desc: Stephen Glass is a staff writer for the respected - current events and policy magazine - The New Republic, and a freelance feature writer for Rolling Stone Magazine and others. By the mid-90s, Glass' articles had turned him into one of the most sought-after young journalists in Washington D.C., but a bizarre chain of events suddenly stopped his careers path. Nominated for four Independent Spirit Awards and a Golden Globe(n)

programme.title: The Green Mile
programme.desc: Set in the Depression of the '30s in southern United States, this drama portrays the remarkable relationship established between Paul Edgecomb (Tom Hanks), a prison guard on Death Row, and John Coffey (Michael Clarke Duncan), a hefty colored man sentenced to death for a brutal double homicide. As the days go by, and after some surprising experiences, Edgecomb begins to have doubts about Coffey's culpability. He is a naïve, apprehensive man with a supernatural gift. Based on a novel by Stephen King, this drama received four Oscar nominations(n)

programme.title: Hamlet 2
programme.desc: Comedy about a failed actor turned drama teacher who, in a final and deluded attempt to make an impact, sets about creating a controversial and 'inspirational' sequel to William Shakespeare's Hamlet(n)

programme.title: Three Kings
programme.desc: Satirical action drama set in the aftermath of the Gulf War. Four soldiers, finding a map indicating the location of secret bunkers inside the Iraqi border, go AWOL and head for the bunkers to get the gold looted from Kuwait which they believe to be hidden inside. However, they find a population being terrorised by Saddam Hussein's forces and desperate for help, and soon realise some things are more important than riches(n)

programme.title: Fido
programme.desc: In a 1950s-era alternate universe where domesticated zombies play a functional role in society by delivering the milk, carrying the mail, and even helping out with household chores, one boy is about to find out just how big of a personal responsibility "pet" ownership truly is. When the Earth passed through a cloud of space dust and the dead arose from their graves to devour the flesh of the living, it first seemed that all hope for humanity was lost. Society's rapid slide into chaos, however, was soon halted when scientists at a company called ZomCom created a special collar that turned the rampaging animated corpses docile. Now, thanks to ZomCom, everything is under control -- or is it? Timmy Robinson (K'Sun Ray) isn't quite convinced. Quiet and withdrawn, the skeptical young boy spends so much time locked away in his room that he's almost become invisible around the household. His mother Helen (Carrie-Anne Moss) has recently purchased a zombie to help keep things tidy around the house though, and when the creature attempts to engage the curious youngster in a game of catch, a friendship is forged between boy and zombie that finds the amiable gut-muncher nicknamed Fido (Billy Connolly) practically becoming a part of the family. Things take a turn for the worse however, when Fido's collar malfunctions and Timmy's neighbors begin dying in droves. When ZomCom's top zombie control specialist Mr. Bottoms (Henry Czerny) moves in across the street from Timmy, the increasingly complicated situation threatens to place a serious stumbling block in the path of human-zombie relations(n)

programme.title: Ted 2
programme.desc: With the help of his best friend John, a sentient teddy bear named Ted fights to be legally recognized as a human so he can have a child with his new wife Tami-Lynn(n)

programme.title: Joy
programme.desc: The tumultuous life of New York-born entrepreneur Joy Mangano, whose invention of the Miracle Mop began the creation a business empire(n)

programme.title: Dead Poets Society
programme.desc: A staid but well-respected prep school is enlivened by a newly-arrived, charismatic English teacher, who inspires his students with unconventional methods and philosophies(n)

programme.title: Sugar
programme.desc: This well-acted, introspective sports drama follows Miguel (Algenis Perez Soto), a talented Dominican baseball player longing to break into the American big leagues in order to provide financial support for his family. While paying his dues in the minors, Miguel experiences a variety of cultural and language barriers despite the kindness of his host family. After an injury he must contemplate his role in the world as well as baseball. Rayniel Rufino, Andre Holland(n)

programme.title: The Big Chop
programme.desc: A girl's love for her afro begins to wane as she grows up and is subjected to teasing by her family and friends. A finalist in the Short Film Competition at the 2016 American Black Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Panic Room
programme.desc: David Fincher's follow-up to Fight Club is a claustrophobic thriller starring Jodie Foster and Kristen Stewart as a mother and daughter trapped in their new house's safe room by a gang of thieves. The housebreakers are a dynamic trio desperate to get their hands on millions of dollars' worth of bonds the previous owner left behind, and their arrival prompts divorcee Meg and 11-year-old Sarah to take refuge in the vault-like room of the title. Unfortunately for them, that's where the loot is concealed, and Fincher ramps up the tension with some exhilarating camera work as a deadly stand-off ensues(n)

programme.title: The Danish Girl
programme.desc: In this touching drama, Danish painter Einar Wegener begins living as a woman named Lili, and undergoes one of the first gender-reassignment surgeries in the 1930s. Lili struggles with her new identity as it strains her marriage to artist Gerda Wegener(n)

programme.title: Dragonfly
programme.desc: Kevin Costner gives a sensitive performance in this intriguing thriller about a doctor who tries to communicate with his dead spouse. After his wife dies while on a Red Cross mission, a man (Costner) is plagued by what he believes are messages from her, and tries to decipher what they mean. Kathy Bates, Joe Morton, Ron Rifkin, Linda Hunt, Susanna Thompson, Jacob Vargas(n)

programme.title: P.S. I Love You
programme.desc: Director Richard LaGravenese's romantic drama stars Hilary Swank as Holly Kennedy, a New York real estate agent forced to come to terms with the unexpected death of her young husband Gerry. Before he died, Gerry wrote her a series of letters, to be delivered across the forthcoming year, hoping to help her grieve. The letters give her vivid flashbacks to their life together and, under his written direction, she visits Gerry's parents in Ireland, where she ultimately finds the strength to move on(n)

programme.title: Mr. Right
programme.desc: Martha finally finds her Mr Right, but he has just one flaw: he is a hitman on the run from his former employers, a crime cartel(n)

programme.title: Rules of Engagement
programme.desc: In this drama, two U.S. Marines who stood side by side on the field of battle are reunited in a court of law. Attorney Hayes Hodges (Tommy Lee Jones) once aspired to a career as an officer, but a serious injury in Vietnam put an end to his military future, leaving him bitter and resentful. Col. Terry L. Childers (Samuel L. Jackson) fought alongside Hodges and once saved his life; when Childers is threatened with a court martial for ordering his troops to fire on civilians during a raid on an American embassy, Hodges is the only lawyer that he can trust, and the case gives Hodges a chance for revenge against the military system that he feels has wronged him. Rules of Engagement also features Kim Delaney, Ben Kingsley, Blair Underwood, and Anne Archer(n)

programme.title: We Were Soldiers
programme.desc: The first major battle of the Vietnam War in 1965, and the soldiers who were involved, are depicted in this drama(n)

programme.title: The Martian
programme.desc: After an exploratory mission goes awry, lone astronaut Mark Watney (Matt Damon) is left for dead on the hostile surface of Mars and must use his scientific ingenuity to homestead an enclosed habitat where he can survive. Meanwhile, the astronauts he left behind realize the severity of his plight and join forces with an international coalition of scientists to launch a rescue mission in defiance of NASA protocol(n)

programme.title: Cast Away
programme.desc: An ambitious corporate troubleshooter is stranded on a deserted island for five years, eventually returning to society as a changed man(n)

programme.title: To Wong Foo, Thanks for Everything! Julie Newmar
programme.desc: Three New York drag queens travel cross-country on their way to Hollywood, but a broken-down car strands them in a narrow-minded country town, where they share makeup tips with the ladies and show the hostile men how to treat women right(n)

programme.title: National Lampoon's Animal House
programme.desc: John Landis directed this rollicking early '60s nostalgia piece reportedly based on screenwriter Chris Miller's real-life experiences as a freshman at prestigious Dartmouth College. Unable to gain acceptance at the snootier fraternities they pledge, Frosh losers Thomas Hulce and Stephen Furst find a home among the Deltas, a motley crew of misfits and sociopaths bent on disrupting the well-starched status quo. Led by seniors (Tim Matheson) and (Peter Riegert), the Delta boys engage in various illegalities that land them in hot water with both the stern college dean (John Vernon) and the neighboring jock fraternity. Their exploits eventually cause them to be placed on "double-secret probation;" finally, they are kicked out of school and, as the dean reminds them, newly eligible for the Vietnam draft. What follows is an anarchic subversion of the annual town parade -- not to mention some genuine hilarity -- as the Deltas raid the festivities for revenge, causing all hell to break loose. While parts of Animal House are uneven, some scenes are side-splittingly funny, particularly the scene in which malcontent literature professor Donald Sutherland smokes pot with his students and discusses some heavy metaphysics. However, the real reason to watch the film is John Belushi as Bluto Blutarsky, the seventh-year senior with a poor memory for world history and a penchant for drinking fifths of Jack Daniels in one draught -- he is spectacular. His memorable performance solidifies his place as one of American cinema's most outrageous comedic performers, in spite of the brevity of his career. In all, Animal House is a highly amusing comedy, sure to bring back memories for anyone who's been to college (even if they never did manage to graduate)(n)

programme.desc: Set in the Depression of the '30s in southern United States, this drama portrays the remarkable relationship established between Paul Edgecomb (Tom Hanks), a prison guard on Death Row, and John Coffey (Michael Clarke Duncan), a hefty colored man sentenced to death for a brutal double homicide. As the days go by, and after some surprising experiences, Edgecomb begins to have doubts about Coffey's culpability. He is a naïve, apprehensive man with a supernatural gift. Based on a novel by Stephen King, this drama received four Oscar nominations(n)

programme.title: Hamlet 2
programme.desc: Comedy about a failed actor turned drama teacher who, in a final and deluded attempt to make an impact, sets about creating a controversial and 'inspirational' sequel to William Shakespeare's Hamlet(n)

programme.title: Three Kings
programme.desc: Satirical action drama set in the aftermath of the Gulf War. Four soldiers, finding a map indicating the location of secret bunkers inside the Iraqi border, go AWOL and head for the bunkers to get the gold looted from Kuwait which they believe to be hidden inside. However, they find a population being terrorised by Saddam Hussein's forces and desperate for help, and soon realise some things are more important than riches(n)

programme.title: Fido
programme.desc: In a 1950s-era alternate universe where domesticated zombies play a functional role in society by delivering the milk, carrying the mail, and even helping out with household chores, one boy is about to find out just how big of a personal responsibility "pet" ownership truly is. When the Earth passed through a cloud of space dust and the dead arose from their graves to devour the flesh of the living, it first seemed that all hope for humanity was lost. Society's rapid slide into chaos, however, was soon halted when scientists at a company called ZomCom created a special collar that turned the rampaging animated corpses docile. Now, thanks to ZomCom, everything is under control -- or is it? Timmy Robinson (K'Sun Ray) isn't quite convinced. Quiet and withdrawn, the skeptical young boy spends so much time locked away in his room that he's almost become invisible around the household. His mother Helen (Carrie-Anne Moss) has recently purchased a zombie to help keep things tidy around the house though, and when the creature attempts to engage the curious youngster in a game of catch, a friendship is forged between boy and zombie that finds the amiable gut-muncher nicknamed Fido (Billy Connolly) practically becoming a part of the family. Things take a turn for the worse however, when Fido's collar malfunctions and Timmy's neighbors begin dying in droves. When ZomCom's top zombie control specialist Mr. Bottoms (Henry Czerny) moves in across the street from Timmy, the increasingly complicated situation threatens to place a serious stumbling block in the path of human-zombie relations(n)

programme.title: Ted 2
programme.desc: With the help of his best friend John, a sentient teddy bear named Ted fights to be legally recognized as a human so he can have a child with his new wife Tami-Lynn(n)

programme.title: Joy
programme.desc: The tumultuous life of New York-born entrepreneur Joy Mangano, whose invention of the Miracle Mop began the creation a business empire(n)

programme.title: Dead Poets Society
programme.desc: A staid but well-respected prep school is enlivened by a newly-arrived, charismatic English teacher, who inspires his students with unconventional methods and philosophies(n)

programme.title: Sugar
programme.desc: This well-acted, introspective sports drama follows Miguel (Algenis Perez Soto), a talented Dominican baseball player longing to break into the American big leagues in order to provide financial support for his family. While paying his dues in the minors, Miguel experiences a variety of cultural and language barriers despite the kindness of his host family. After an injury he must contemplate his role in the world as well as baseball. Rayniel Rufino, Andre Holland(n)

programme.title: The Big Chop
programme.desc: A girl's love for her afro begins to wane as she grows up and is subjected to teasing by her family and friends. A finalist in the Short Film Competition at the 2016 American Black Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Panic Room
programme.desc: David Fincher's follow-up to Fight Club is a claustrophobic thriller starring Jodie Foster and Kristen Stewart as a mother and daughter trapped in their new house's safe room by a gang of thieves. The housebreakers are a dynamic trio desperate to get their hands on millions of dollars' worth of bonds the previous owner left behind, and their arrival prompts divorcee Meg and 11-year-old Sarah to take refuge in the vault-like room of the title. Unfortunately for them, that's where the loot is concealed, and Fincher ramps up the tension with some exhilarating camera work as a deadly stand-off ensues(n)

programme.title: The Danish Girl
programme.desc: In this touching drama, Danish painter Einar Wegener begins living as a woman named Lili, and undergoes one of the first gender-reassignment surgeries in the 1930s. Lili struggles with her new identity as it strains her marriage to artist Gerda Wegener(n)

programme.title: Dragonfly
programme.desc: Kevin Costner gives a sensitive performance in this intriguing thriller about a doctor who tries to communicate with his dead spouse. After his wife dies while on a Red Cross mission, a man (Costner) is plagued by what he believes are messages from her, and tries to decipher what they mean. Kathy Bates, Joe Morton, Ron Rifkin, Linda Hunt, Susanna Thompson, Jacob Vargas(n)

programme.title: P.S. I Love You
programme.desc: Director Richard LaGravenese's romantic drama stars Hilary Swank as Holly Kennedy, a New York real estate agent forced to come to terms with the unexpected death of her young husband Gerry. Before he died, Gerry wrote her a series of letters, to be delivered across the forthcoming year, hoping to help her grieve. The letters give her vivid flashbacks to their life together and, under his written direction, she visits Gerry's parents in Ireland, where she ultimately finds the strength to move on(n)

programme.title: Mr. Right
programme.desc: Martha finally finds her Mr Right, but he has just one flaw: he is a hitman on the run from his former employers, a crime cartel(n)

programme.title: Rules of Engagement
programme.desc: In this drama, two U.S. Marines who stood side by side on the field of battle are reunited in a court of law. Attorney Hayes Hodges (Tommy Lee Jones) once aspired to a career as an officer, but a serious injury in Vietnam put an end to his military future, leaving him bitter and resentful. Col. Terry L. Childers (Samuel L. Jackson) fought alongside Hodges and once saved his life; when Childers is threatened with a court martial for ordering his troops to fire on civilians during a raid on an American embassy, Hodges is the only lawyer that he can trust, and the case gives Hodges a chance for revenge against the military system that he feels has wronged him. Rules of Engagement also features Kim Delaney, Ben Kingsley, Blair Underwood, and Anne Archer(n)

programme.title: We Were Soldiers
programme.desc: The first major battle of the Vietnam War in 1965, and the soldiers who were involved, are depicted in this drama(n)

programme.title: The Martian
programme.desc: After an exploratory mission goes awry, lone astronaut Mark Watney (Matt Damon) is left for dead on the hostile surface of Mars and must use his scientific ingenuity to homestead an enclosed habitat where he can survive. Meanwhile, the astronauts he left behind realize the severity of his plight and join forces with an international coalition of scientists to launch a rescue mission in defiance of NASA protocol(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Trapper Keeper. A pointed satire about the 2000 presidential election shares time with a parody of The Terminator in this typically irreverent episode of South Park. After Eric's snazzy Trapper Keeper makes him the coolest kid in class, the kids meet a robot from the future that was sent to destroy the Trapper Keeper. If he fails, robots will eliminate humans in a war. Mr. Garrison, now teaching kindergarten, holds a class election that quickly spins out of control after one student is unable to commit to a candidate. That student's name -- Florida. "Trapper Keeper" is highlighted by parodies of 2001 and Akira, and debuted November 15, 2000, on Comedy Central(n)

With help from the mad Dr. Mephisto, the Jakovasaurus successfully reproduces. The rest of the town attempts to ship the annoying creatures to Memphis (and then France), while Kenny, Kyle, and Stan keep Eric from stopping them. Loaded with references to Raiders of the Lost Ark, The Wizard of Oz, The Blue Lagoon, and numerous other pop culture landmarks, "Jakovasaurus" first aired June 16, 1999, on Comedy Central(n)

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Grace is summoned to a Soho brothel, where a woman is holding a man at knifepoint, claiming he knows the whereabouts of her 16-year-old sister, who has been missing for six months. Revisiting the familiar case, the detective feels guilty she did not do more to help the family earlier. When a body is found, she follows a lead to the missing girl's old teacher, who had acted as her support buddy when she turned to prostitution to pay for her heroin habit, and nearly loses control when she is overcome by anger in the interrogation room. programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.sub-title: The Clue of the Savant's Thumb.
programme.desc: Feature-length episode of the quirky crime drama. A dead body impossibly vanishes from a locked study - giving self-styled paranormal investigator Joey Ross a fresh mystery to solve. She could do with some help from her old sidekick, the master of illusion Jonathan Creek - but he has moved on and shows little interest in the case. As Joey starts digging she meets the investigating officer - Gideon Pryke, a sharp-minded DI who remembers Creek from one of his previous cases. But he's not quite the man he used to be. Alan Davies stars, with Sheridan Smith, Rik Mayall, Joanna Lumley and Nigel Planer.(n)

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Double bill. Nikki and Jack are called to a petrol station where three people have been shot dead, and conclude it is the work of a concealed shooter working from long range - a sniper is at large in London. They combine ballistics and wound pathology with the killer-profiling skills of senior investigator DCI Jane De Freitas, as they work to find this seemingly random murderer before panic hits the city. Starring Emilia Fox, David Caves and Richard Lintern, with Zoe Telford and Steve Wall.(n)

programme.title: Crazy, Stupid, Love.
programme.desc: Sad-sack divorcée Cal Weaver (Steve Carell) finds his second wind in life after meeting a handsome young ladies' man who teaches him how to become a master of the modern dating scene. A devoted family man who married his high school sweetheart, Cal had a great house and a stable job when his wife, Emily (Julianne Moore), left him to be with another man. When Emily announces that she's filing for divorce, Cal finds himself awkwardly thrust into the dating scene and begins drinking his nights away at the local pub. Just when it's starting to look as if there's no hope for Cal, confirmed bachelor Jacob Palmer (Ryan Gosling) decides to add some much-needed excitement to the sulking, newly single father's life. Before long, Cal's rough edges have all been smoothed out; he's mastered the fine art of flirting and develops a distinct sense of style that sets him apart from the pack. But just as Cal starts to turn heads, his adolescent son, Robbie, develops a big crush on his teenage babysitter, Jessica. Unfortunately for Robbie, Jessica only has eyes for Cal. Meanwhile, Cal can't help but feel like something substantial is missing from his life, and decides that the only way to set things straight is by listening to his heart(n)

programme.desc: Audrey joins Jeff at his company Christmas party, where they compete to see who is funnier. Elsewhere, the friends struggle to understand Russell's efforts to make everyone miserable until he makes a confession about his childhood. David Spade stars.(n)

programme.title: Melissa & Joey
programme.desc: Lennox's boyfriend begins to feel neglected when she spends time on her new blog instead of with him. Meanwhile, Joe sets Mel up on a blind date, and in exchange he wants to take out her attractive friend Ariel. Comedy, starring Melissa Joan Hart and Joey Lawrence.(n)

programme.title: Melissa & Joey
programme.desc: A friend of Mel's decides she wants to have a baby, and believes Joe is the most suitable person to father her child. Meanwhile, Lennox and Haskell disagree over what to do with a rare book when they discover its value. Comedy, starring Melissa Joan Hart and Joey Lawrence.(n)

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Riley makes a bet with Ben that he cannot get a second date with Heather, but when she fails to jump at the chance to go out with him again, Ben resorts to desperate measures to win the wager. programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Tucker acts like a lawyer in front of his father because he has forgotten to tell him he has dropped out of law school and works in TV. Meanwhile, Riley has a crush on a British guy, but Bonnie mistakenly thinks she has fallen for Danny. Comedy, starring Jean-Luc Bilodeau.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Part two of two. Meanwhile, Marshall and Lily enjoy their first night away together since the birth of Marvin and intend to savour every moment, but end up feeling anxious about their son.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Robin learns that Barney failed to ask her father's permission before proposing, so she forces him to get Robin Sr's approval as soon as possible. programme.title: New Girl
programme.desc: When Nick's attraction to Reagan starts affecting Schmidt and Cece's relationship, they enact a plan to demystify her, in hopes of helping Nick get over her. Meanwhile, Winston teaches Reagan the art of the break-up. Megan Fox stars.(n)

programme.title: New Girl
programme.desc: Reagan causes chaos between Nick and Winston when she tells them she'll sleep with just one of them in an attempt to challenge the guys' indecisiveness. Meanwhile, Schmidt is reunited with his college frenemy, Benjamin, when looking at wedding venues with Cece.(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: The squad has time to kill when the arrival of the Serbian president's motorcade to Brooklyn is delayed, so Peralta launches the seventh annual Jimmy Jab Games, an eccentric series of races and contests held in the precinct building. programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: As part of the relationship agreement, Sheldon reluctantly has to take care of Amy when she gets sick, but she loves the extra attention so much she pretends to remain in poor health. programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard tries to get Sheldon into the Christmas mood by playing a game, but things do not go as planned when Sheldon reveals a childhood trauma. programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: With their wedding looming, Robin and Barney try to relax at a restaurant, but plot revenge on a couple who ruin their evening. Meanwhile, Marshall takes Marvin on a last-minute trip to Minnesota to see his family before leaving for Rome.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: The gang travels to Long Island to attend Robin and Barney's wedding, but the couple make a startling discovery about their families en route. Comedy, starring Josh Radnor and Alyson Hannigan.(n)

programme.title: New Girl
programme.desc: The wedding is looming, but Jess is still doing the alterations on Cece's dress. Schmidt gets into trouble with his colleagues when he plans his nuptials instead of doing his work. programme.title: New Girl

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Cindy and Holly have some mother and daughter time, while Louis comforts Simone when she tells him that her mum is dying of Cancer. Elsewhere, Prince has his eyes on the prize, and Kim is feeling lost.(n)

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Ben's attempts to flirt with a student who goes to Riley's new British boyfriend's college go awry, causing Philip to potentially face losing both his job and his visa. Meanwhile, Tucker puts on a fake English accent in order to attract women.(n)

programme.desc: The temperature rises between Nick and Reagan when they compete to see who can provide the loft apartment with the best air conditioning unit during a heat wave. Winston uses his stern `cop voice' to help Schmidt get a nervous Cece ready for an audition to be a newsreader.(n)

programme.title: New Girl
programme.desc: Jess returns from jury duty, so Reagan prepares to move out of the loft - and out of Nick's life. Winston and Cece help Schmidt get over his fear of public dancing.(n)

programme.desc: When an Internal Affairs investigator reveals there may be a mole in the precinct, Peralta and Holt must find out who it is before Deputy Chief Wuntch gets wind of the situation. Jeffords and Diaz visit a silent disco to uncover leads for their new drug task force.(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Peralta hits it off with Sophia, a woman he meets in a bar, only to find out she is the defence attorney representing a perpetrator he is trying to put behind bars. programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon isn't pleased when his assistant Alex starts flirting with Leonard and has a word with her about it. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Jim Parsons.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The guys become stranded in the middle of nowhere when Leonard's car is stolen en route to the Bakersfield comic-book convention. Meanwhile, back at home, the women try to work out why the guys are so fascinated with such publications.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Marshall is forced to take to the road in an uneconomical car when he struggles to find a way to get back to New York in time for the wedding. Robin discovers James has cheated on his husband Tom and is getting a divorce, and begins to worry how Barney will react to the news. Meanwhile, Ted fears being the only single man at the marriage ceremony and staying alone at a romantic hotel. American sitcom, starring Josh Radnor and Alyson Hannigan.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Barney is upset when he discovers Ted still has feelings for Robin, and works through his anger at a poker night. Marshall hasn't made it back to New York yet, but manages to help settle their dispute via a video call. Meanwhile, Lily realises she is Robin's only female friend and begins to worry she could be lonely while she's in Rome for a year, so sets about attempting to find her a replacement buddy. American sitcom, starring Josh Radnor and Alyson Hannigan.(n)

programme.desc: The night before the wedding, Nick and Winston help Schmidt rewrite his vows, while Jess believes Sam is going to propose to her.(n)

programme.title: Shark
programme.desc: The documentary series continues, revealing how the creatures are far more than just the hunters they are sometimes perceived as. New discoveries have revealed a hidden side to the shark's character, uncovering how their intricate social lives involve complicated courtship rituals, surprising ways of raising their young, and impressive powers of navigation. Paul McGann narrates.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Animal Mind
programme.desc: Chris Packham continues his exploration of the minds of the cleverest animals on the planet by examining the problem-solving abilities of crows. He also investigates the extraordinary range of animal intelligence, examining bees that navigate, cockatoos that can pick locks and an ingenious octopus.(n)

programme.title: Tigers About the House
programme.desc: Australian zookeeper Giles Clark continues to play mother to tiger cubs Spot and Stripe, who - at nine weeks of age - are going from strength to strength.(n)

programme.title: Life Story
programme.desc: David Attenborough details the transition animals go through as they grow into adults. Looking at examples including a tiger cub whose family is under threat, a vulnerable veined octopus and a pair of sibling cheetahs guarding against starvation, the veteran naturalist illustrates how they develop new skills and learn how to survive on their own.(n)

programme.title: Nature's Miracle Orphans
programme.desc: In Australia, Ellie Harrison meets Sue, who has been caring for bare-nosed wombat Stacey since her mother was killed four months previously. To get the animal used to the outside world, they take her into they garden for the first time. However, interaction with other wombats is a vital part of rehabilitation, so they need to find a suitable companion before she can be released. Wildlife cameraman Max Hug Williams is in Costa Rica, finding out how three-toed sloth Newbie is responding to treatment and meeting a 10-month-old anteater as he learns to forage the critters he needs to keep him going.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Animal Mind
programme.desc: Chris Packham examines why the most intelligent animals on the planet are also the most social. Swimming with a pod of dolphins in the Bahamas, he explores their language and learns how they are able to recognise themselves in a mirror. He also witnesses the deviousness of chimpanzees and watches elephants as they mourn their dead.(n)

programme.title: Tigers About the House
programme.desc: Zookeeper Giles Clark faces a serious problem when, at two months of age, the tiger cubs he has been hand-rearing show signs of outgrowing his home.(n)

programme.title: Life Story
programme.desc: The importance of homes to animals, not only as a place to live but as a shelter from the elements and a refuge from enemies. A pack of African hunting dogs have made their home on a vast plain in Zambia, but it's far from safe as they must battle hyenas and protect their young. Hermit crabs on a tropical island settle down in empty snail shells - and when a new property washes ashore, they all form a queue, then move up the housing chain until all the shells are taken. On the edge of the Sahara are chimpanzees, whose survival relies on knowing where to find water in the most extreme droughts. Here the elders lead a troop on a brutal trek to a dried-out riverbed to dig wells.(n)

programme.title: Made of Honor
programme.desc: A handsome and successful bachelor is taken aback when his dream girl asks him to be the "maid" of honour in her upcoming wedding. Tom and Hannah have been best friends for years. Through all the hard times, Hannah has been the one constant in Tom's life, and the one person he knows he can always rely on. When Hannah leaves on a business trip to Scotland, Tom is surprised to realise how truly lonely he is without her, so the moment she returns, Tom resolves to ask for her hand in marriage. But apparently Hannah's trip wasn't all business, because upon returning home Hannah announces that she has gotten engaged to a dashing Scotsman and will soon be starting a new life overseas. With his spirits crushed but his love for Hannah stronger than ever before, Tom reluctantly agrees to be the "maid" of honour so that he can prove his love in no uncertain terms and convince her to call off the wedding before true happiness slips through his fingers(n)

programme.title: Truth
programme.desc: Docudrama about the controversial 2004 "60 Minutes" exposé on US President George W Bush's military service, and the fallout that producer Mary Mapes and anchor Dan Rather suffered after questions were raised about the validity of key documents in the report(n)

programme.title: Ricki and the Flash
programme.desc: An ageing rocker returns home to her estranged family after years on the road following her dreams, and must face the music as she tries to make things right with her loved ones(n)

programme.title: Machine Gun Preacher
programme.desc: Gerard Butler stars in Marc Forster's violent, fact-based drama about a substance-addicted criminal who finds God and relocates to Sudan to offer his own idiosyncratic brand of Christian charity. The film initially portrays Sam Childers as being a far from nice man: a misogynistic biker whose life is steeped in crime, narcotics and violence, and who quickly returns to armed robbery almost as soon as he's released from jail. But while he was inside, his wife Lynn found Jesus, and, after Sam gets stabbed, she urges him to join her at church. Sam subsequently has his own Damascene moment and starts life afresh, founding his own (legitimate) construction company. Before long he has also built his own church. But it's only after a trip to Sudan, where he witnesses the devastation wrought by the marauding Lord's Resistance Army, that he truly becomes driven. Relocating to the African country, he sets up a faith-based centre to care for victims of the LRA's violence and rape. And also takes up arms to literally fight the good fight... Also starring Michael Shannon(n)

programme.title: Reign Of Fire
programme.desc: A survivalist teams up with a military man to slay fire-breathing dragons in post-apocalyptic 2020(n)

programme.title: Because I Said So

programme.title: Rocky III
programme.desc: Rocky's lifestyle of wealth and idleness is suddenly shaken when a powerful fighter challenges him to a fight for the championship. After being beaten, the previously over-confident Rocky resumes his training in preparation for a re-match(n)

programme.title: Ricki and the Flash
programme.desc: An ageing rocker returns home to her estranged family after years on the road following her dreams, and must face the music as she tries to make things right with her loved ones(n)

programme.title: Made of Honor
programme.desc: A handsome and successful bachelor is taken aback when his dream girl asks him to be the "maid" of honour in her upcoming wedding. Tom and Hannah have been best friends for years. Through all the hard times, Hannah has been the one constant in Tom's life, and the one person he knows he can always rely on. When Hannah leaves on a business trip to Scotland, Tom is surprised to realise how truly lonely he is without her, so the moment she returns, Tom resolves to ask for her hand in marriage. But apparently Hannah's trip wasn't all business, because upon returning home Hannah announces that she has gotten engaged to a dashing Scotsman and will soon be starting a new life overseas. With his spirits crushed but his love for Hannah stronger than ever before, Tom reluctantly agrees to be the "maid" of honour so that he can prove his love in no uncertain terms and convince her to call off the wedding before true happiness slips through his fingers(n)

As their narcissism and downright aggressive laziness threaten to tear the family apart, these two middle-aged, immature, overgrown boys will orchestrate an insane, elaborate plan to bring their parents back together(n)

programme.title: Lakeview Terrace
programme.desc: An interracial couple moves into their California dream home, only to find themselves the target of their volatile next-door neighbor -- a racist LAPD officer -- in this tightly wound thriller starring Samuel L. Jackson and Kerry Washington. Newlyweds Chris and Lisa seem like they have the perfect marriage and now, with their new home in the exclusive community Lakeview Terrace, the perfect life as well, but things soon turn ugly in the posh neighborhood when they begin to receive threats from their neighbor Abel, a middle-aged LAPD officer who has obvious objections to the couple's interracial marriage. What starts as an attitude problem soon morphs into full-on harassment, and before long the couple finds that their worries go far beyond their property values -- or the encroaching California wildfire burning in view of their community -- as they begin to fear for their lives(n)

programme.title: Cinderella
programme.desc: An orphan named Ella is treated cruelly by her stepmother and stepsisters, who force her to do menial chores. However, her life changes forever when she meets a prince in this charming take on the classic fairy tale(n)

programme.title: Bolt
programme.desc: The story revolves around a dog named Bolt and a girl, penny who star in a famous television show. Bolt plays a character with superpowers and believes that he possesses them even in real life until he finds out the truth(n)

programme.title: Wayne's World

programme.desc: Beatrix Kiddo aka "The Bride" was once part of a group of elite, top class female assassins, until the group leader, "Bill", and the other assassins turn against her and leave her for dead. Five years later "The Bride" wakes up from the coma the assassins left her in and begins her quest for vengeance. She works her way down the list of her ex-colleagues leaving her boss Bill for last. Hell hath no fury like a woman scorned…(n)

Soon released by the CIA with a mission to escort beautiful Russian Nadia back to the United States, Griffith quickly learns that the very same arms dealer he sought to wipe out is willing to kill for a valuable secret known only to his strong-willed charge(n)

programme.title: John Ford Goes to War
programme.desc: In this documentary centered on legendary filmmaker John Ford's cinematic contributions to Allied morale during World War II, actor/musician Kris Kristofferson narrates as the How Green Was My Valley director turns his back on Tinseltown in order to fulfill his patriotic duty. By the time the United States became involved in World War II, John Ford was already a film legend, but when Uncle Sam came calling the veteran filmmaker eagerly packed his bags and set his sites on the frontlines. Though Ford did sustain battlefield injuries during the production of the Oscar-winning documentary The Battle of Midway, the remarkable film endeared him to patriotic American audiences across the country and his next wartime effort, 1943's December 7th, proceeded to earn the filmmaker yet another Oscar. In addition to featuring footage from these and other, lesser-known wartime films from Ford, this documentary also offers an intimate look at the complex filmmaker and explores his remarkable legacy through both archive footage and interviews with such notable directors as Oliver Stone and Peter Bogdanovich(n)

programme.title: Hudson Hawk
programme.desc: Before The Da Vinci Code there was Hudson Hawk, an action comedy starring Bruce Willis as an international cat burglar who is duped into stealing priceless works of art by Leonardo Da Vinci. Unbeknown to him, the paintings contain hidden codes that reveal how to invent a machine that converts lead into gold, and his mystery benefactors plan to use it for world domination. Fun from start to finish, this has now become a firm cult classic. Also starring Andie MacDowell, Richard E Grant and Danny Aiello(n)

Guest starring Carmen Electra (Baywatch), with Tony Shalhoub.(n)

programme.desc: Agent LaRoche suspects Hightower of the murder of a police killer, who was burned to death in custody, after she reveals that she was sleeping with one of his victims. Jane also discovers that the head of CBI is linked to the death of an archaeology professor, prompting him to jeopardise his own career to help clear her name. Crime drama, starring Pruitt Taylor Vince and Aunjanue Ellis.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane believes a doctor's murderer was a fellow physician, and discovers the victim was the head of a transplant unit. He is convinced wealthy people are being given preferential treatment at the hospital where the medic worked, but his sleuthing lands him in trouble with a patient's gun-wielding bodyguard. Elsewhere, Lisbon is demoted following a slip of the tongue. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker.(n)

programme.desc: The team attempts to sabotage the operation of a corrupt superstore owner who threatens a small town. Drama about hi-tech crooks who use their skills to right corporate wrongs, battle injustice in the corridors of power and steal from wealthy criminals.(n)

programme.title: Leverage
programme.desc: The team prevents a businessman from ruining his company and destroying the town it supports. Drama about hi-tech crooks who use their skills to right corporate wrongs, battle injustice in the corridors of power and steal from wealthy criminals.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs and the team are called in when a Navy reservist returns home to find her husband missing and her living room covered in blood, and make a grim discovery when they find a finger in the bin. Meanwhile, Ziva ruffles a few feathers by insisting on continuing her investigation into the murder of her father, asking for permission to go to Rome on the trail of the chief suspect. Mark Harmon stars.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: New Mossad director Orli Elbaz asks for the team's help in finding Ilan Bodnar when one of her agents is shot dead in Virginia, telling Gibbs he was investigating several operatives who had gone rogue after Eli David's death. Ziva travels with Tony to Berlin in her pursuit of Bodnar, the man she believes was responsible for the death of her father. Guest starring Marina Sirtis (Star Trek: The Next Generation).(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: The agents track down the killer of a man who believed he was abducted by aliens, and the case becomes more complicated when his body is stolen from the coroner's van. programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: The owner of an exclusive dating website is murdered, and although Jane is certain the victim's wife is to blame, she is released due to a lack of evidence. When holes begin to appear in her alibi, the consultant discovers a way to convict her of the crime, while the rest of the team learns that some of the women at the agency are filming their encounters with wealthy men so they can blackmail them. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: Leverage
programme.desc: The team travels into Oregon wine country to steal a rare bottle of vintage as part of the current con against the greedy owner of a winery. Drama, starring Timothy Hutton and Gina Bellman.(n)

programme.title: Leverage
programme.desc: The team creates a global toy craze to take on a CEO who is about to release a dangerous product onto the market. Drama, starring Timothy Hutton.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team tracks Bodnar's SUV to a remote house in the countryside, but inside find only his dead accomplice - identified as a South African mercenary who helped Bodnar procure diamonds. programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A cook from a US Navy destroyer tells McGee and Gibbs he believes someone is stalking him with the intention of trying to make him poison the crew, and a picture on a stolen phone leads the team to a group testing the psychological effects of surveillance. Meanwhile, Richard Parsons from the Inspector General's office closes in on Ziva as he investigates the death of Ilan Bodnar, the man who killed her father. Guest starring Colin Hanks (Gus Grimly in the Fargo TV series).(n)

programme.desc: Bullock is disappointed when someone neglects to bring a present to the CIA Secret Santa Party, and Stan resolves to find out which of his colleagues has turned Scrooge.(n)

programme.desc: Lois runs for the position of school board president but refuses to overturn a decision to sack a teacher, prompting Peter to compete in the election and launch a smear campaign against her. Animated comedy, featuring the voices of Alex Borstein and Seth MacFarlane.(n)

programme.desc: Stan becomes a traffic warden in a bid to be taken more seriously, and suddenly finds himself caught up in allegations of corruption and favouritism. Hayley poses nude for a college art class and is surprised to see Roger is one of the students.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter accidentally injures the best player in his company's softball team, and tries to get on Mr Weed's good side by inviting new neighbour Joe to join as a replacement - unaware that he is a wheelchair user. Animated comedy, with the voices of Seth McFarlane and Alex Borstein.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: The family sets out on a trip to New York in a bid to win back Chris's place in a Scout group, but Peter takes a wrong turn en route and ends up at a Native American casino - where Lois becomes obsessed with the slot machines. programme.desc: Lois becomes a theatre director and decides to stage The King and I as her first production. However, Peter ends up taking over the show and replaces Loretta with Diane Simmons in the lead role.(n)

In her first case since arriving in Los Angeles, Brenda uncovers a disastrous love affair and a mysterious past as she investigates a death at the home of a multi-millionaire computer company executive.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates when Navy Seal Chad McBride's wife receives a package from Riyadh in Saudi Arabia containing her husband's severed head, which Palmer discovers contains very high levels of radiation. McBride's commanding officer reveals the soldier was on a top-secret reconnaissance mission and asks Vance not to disclose the details to anyone. Meanwhile, Richard Parsons tries to get Gibbs to take responsibility for the many unnecessary deaths for which he holds the NCIS team accountable.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The American crime drama returns with the team still reeling from the Department of Defence investigation, with Ziva, McGee and Tony having handed in their badges. Parsons continues his inquiries into Gibbs and his agents, but events take a turn when an explosion kills the Secretary of the US Navy and seriously injures the director of Homeland Security. When attempts are made on the lives of Gibbs and Tony, it appears that all of the NCIS agents are in mortal danger. Starring Mark Harmon and Colin Hanks.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The American naval crime drama returns, joined by a new recruit played by Jennifer Esposito. The team investigates a deadly car explosion in DC that seems to be connected to Special Agent Nick Torres's disappearance six months earlier, while on a deep-cover operation in Argentina.(n)

programme.title: Mr. Popper's Penguins
programme.desc: Jim Carrey stars in director Mark Waters' family comedy, loosely based on a classic children's book. Tom Popper is a New York property shark with a failed marriage and a strained relationship with his kids. Popper's own father was an explorer, usually absent while Tom was growing up. That could be reason for Tom's emotional disengagement, but his father certainly is the reason Tom ends up receiving a crate of six gentoo penguins - a bequest from the old man's deathbed. Manhattan isn't the obvious place in which to care for the birds, but not only does Popper quickly bond with his charges, his adventures with them also act as a springboard for possible reconciliation with his family - as well as ample opportunity for Carrey to ply his trademarked rubber-faced, flexed-limbed comedic turn. The penguins are real ones, their antics only enhanced rather than generated by CGI. And the only dark cloud on his horizon is the zoo's Nat Jones, who believes the creatures would be better off with him than in Popper's apartment. Also starring Ophelia Lovibond as Popper's assistant Pippi(n)

programme.desc: A powerful Native American chief agrees to take part in peace talks with Washington after an encounter with a sympathetic scout. However, a group of renegade warriors are unwilling to surrender their arms and their actions prompt a bigoted government official to use brutal methods. Western, starring Dana Andrews, Kent Smith, Nestor Paiva and Henry Brandon.(n)

programme.title: The Ladykillers
programme.desc: A criminal mastermind and his gang come up with a cunning scheme to steal a fortune, but their plan is threatened by the unsuspecting elderly landlady of the boarding house they are staying in. They decide to dispose of her, which proves easier said than done. Classic Ealing comedy, with Alec Guinness, Peter Sellers, Herbert Lom, Katie Johnson, Cecil Parker, Danny Green and Jack Warner.(n)

programme.title: The Spy Who Came in from the Cold
programme.desc: A burnt-out British spy is ordered to venture undercover in East Germany. He begins by faking his resignation and subsequent alcoholic depression to dupe the enemy into trusting him, but, as he becomes further embroiled in his mission, he comes to realise that he is merely a pawn. Espionage thriller, based on John Le Carre's novel, starring Richard Burton, Claire Bloom, Oskar Werner and Peter Van Eyck.(n)

programme.title: The War Wagon
programme.desc: A convict is released from prison and swears vengeance on the corrupt mining contractor who took his gold-rich land. On the way, he encounters an old enemy who reveals that the gold from the mine is about to be transported in an armoured stagecoach - and suggests they join forces to steal it. Western, starring John Wayne, Kirk Douglas, Bruce Cabot and Howard Keel.(n)

programme.title: The Rewrite
programme.desc: A washed-up Hollywood screenwriter takes a job at a small university, planning to exploit his position as a local celebrity and do as little work as possible. His cynical outlook begins to change when he falls for a single mother working toward her degree, while a talented pupil makes him consider what he wants from his life. Romantic comedy, with Hugh Grant, Marisa Tomei, Allison Janney and JK Simmons.(n)

programme.title: Transformers: Dark of the Moon
programme.desc: The heroic autobots discover that a spaceship from their own planet crashed into the moon decades ago, carrying their former leader and an incredibly powerful device. They must fight to defend the human race as their enemies the decepticons plot to use this machine to rebuild their own world and destroy the Earth. Sci-fi adventure sequel, with Shia LaBeouf, Josh Duhamel and Rosie Huntington-Whiteley.(n)

programme.title: Goon
programme.desc: An underachieving bouncer is the black sheep of a family of doctors, until he beats an ice hockey player in a fight, and is recruited by the team. While he has little sporting prowess, his ability to beat up opposing players leads him to a successful career - and a showdown with his equally violent hero. Comedy, starring Seann William Scott, Jay Baruchel and Liev Schreiber.(n)

programme.title: Red Army
programme.desc: Premiere. Documentary about the Soviet Union's ice hockey team, examining how their sporting triumphs reflected the international political situation during the Cold War era. It also tells the story of captain Slava Fetisov, who was hailed as one of the nation's greatest heroes, but came to be regarded as a despised political enemy. In English and Russian.(n)

programme.title: All That Heaven Allows
programme.desc: A wealthy New England widow breaks all the taboos of her conservative social circle by falling madly in love with her younger gardener. Her friends and grown-up children are scandalised as she contemplates marrying him, leaving her with a dilemma - to either bow to convention or take a chance at being happy. Romantic drama, with Jane Wyman, Rock Hudson, Agnes Moorehead and Conrad Nagel.(n)

programme.title: The Lawless Breed
programme.desc: A gunslinger newly released from prison tells the story of his eventful life to a newspaper reporter in the hope of salvaging his brutal reputation. Fact-based Western, starring Rock Hudson and Julie Adams.(n)

programme.title: Sherlock Holmes and the Secret Weapon
programme.desc: The 19th-century sleuth and his indefatigable sidekick Watson are transported to Second World War London, where they set out to foil a Nazi attempt to steal part of an experimental weapon. Mystery thriller, starring Basil Rathbone and Nigel Bruce.(n)

programme.title: Mary, Queen of Scots
programme.desc: Historical biopic about the life and loves of the ill-fated 16th-century monarch, whose opposition to her cousin Elizabeth I led to her downfall and execution. Starring Vanessa Redgrave, Glenda Jackson, Timothy Dalton, Patrick McGoohan, Nigel Davenport and Ian Holm.(n)

programme.title: Battleship
programme.desc: A reckless slacker joins the Navy, hoping to win the respect of his girlfriend's father, a stern admiral. He and his shipmates are put to the ultimate test as part of a force of vessels that must battle an invading fleet of powerful alien spaceships. Sci-fi adventure, starring Taylor Kitsch, Liam Neeson and Alexander Skarsgard. Edited for language and violence.(n)

programme.title: High Crimes
programme.desc: A leading attorney's idyllic life turns sour when her husband is accused by the military of slaughtering defenceless villagers in El Salvador. programme.desc: The chef serves simple recipes using winter vegetables grown in his Essex garden. He prepares a seasonal coleslaw and bubble and squeak, and uses homegrown cabbage to make an Italian soup.(n)

programme.title: The Piglet Files
programme.desc: Peter goes undercover as a waiter to shadow a French businessman who is secretly a spy.(n)

programme.title: Sorry
programme.desc: Hen-pecked batchelor Timothy comes to the aid of a young runaway, believing her fate rests in his hands. Starring Ronnie Corbett.(n)

programme.title: The Thin Blue Line
programme.desc: The chance of promotion looms and Fowler decides he needs to become more respectable, leading him to believe marrying Patricia might improve his image. Old enemy Grim is also after the plum post. Ben Elton's comedy, starring Rowan Atkinson.(n)

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victor and Margaret get stuck for hours in a bank holiday traffic jam, with miles of cars behind them, and nothing but the unwelcome sight of a horse's backside in front. Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Hobbo discovers that an infirm friend needs help to bury his pet in the churchyard, and calls on Alvin and Entwistle to carry out the deed. However, the mission becomes complicated when the police begin to suspect the trio are up to no good. Comedy, starring Russ Abbot, Burt Kwouk and Brian Murphy.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Behind Every Bush There Is Not Necessarily a Howard.
programme.desc: Hobbo enlists his friends in a scheme to help Toby win back his ex-wife - but finds she only has eyes for Morton. Meanwhile, Howard tries to keep Pearl from interfering with his bike ride with Marina, and Cooper and Walsh test a new piece of in-car technology. Long-running rural comedy, starring Russ Abbot, Trevor Bannister, Peter Sallis and Burt Kwouk.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Pearl throws Howard out of the house, prompting him to declare he has sworn off women for good - but Hobbo and friends take it upon themselves to get him to talk to Marina first. Meanwhile, Cooper and Walsh have their car valeted after receiving complaints from the sergeant, Glenda tries to whip herself and Barry into shape in time for Gloria's wedding, and Hobbo finds it difficult to avoid Miss Davenport's attentions at the library.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The inmates face a day of hard labour digging drains on a lonely stretch of moorland. However, Fletcher soon finds a way of turning the situation to his advantage. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: He Ain't Heavy, He's My Uncle.
programme.desc: Uncle Albert falls victim to muggers, so Del-Boy resolves to take the law into his own hands, while Rodney becomes a director in Trotters Independent Traders - and his first job is to give the car a good clean. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney tries to help a drunken woman on the street, but his good deed backfires. Fearful of a life behind bars, he promptly goes into hiding - unaware devious brother Del has set him up as a joke. Comedy, starring Nicholas Lyndhurst and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: The Thin Blue Line
programme.desc: The chance of promotion looms and Fowler decides he needs to become more respectable, leading him to believe marrying Patricia might improve his image. Old enemy Grim is also after the plum post. Ben Elton's comedy, starring Rowan Atkinson.(n)

programme.title: Sorry
programme.desc: Hen-pecked batchelor Timothy comes to the aid of a young runaway, believing her fate rests in his hands. Starring Ronnie Corbett.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The inmates face a day of hard labour digging drains on a lonely stretch of moorland. However, Fletcher soon finds a way of turning the situation to his advantage. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Rights of Man (Except for Howard).
programme.desc: Hobbo tells Howard to stand up for himself if he still wants Pearl to take him back - but his wife pours cold water on his attempts to impress her. Marina decides to seize the moment with Mr Waddle, and the police pull Tom over for driving too slowly, only to end up sharing his bacon sandwiches. Russ Abbot, Robert Fyfe and Juliette Kaplan star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: In a bid to persuade Pearl to take back her errant husband, Howard's friends try to convince her he is living as a tramp - but he is far from happy at the prospect of going it alone in the wilderness. Meanwhile, Toby's attempt to regain Monica's affections is thwarted by a dog, and Marina decides to dress down for a change. Comedy, starring Russ Abbot, Robert Fyfe and Juliette Kaplan.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Wondering if Pearl still loves him, Howard asks Hobbo to give her a peck on the cheek from him - only to become even more despondent when he sees his wife deliver a passionate kiss. Meanwhile, Glenda sends Barry off to paint a landscape, hoping the activity will distract him from his hunger - but fish and chips is the only thing on his mind. Comedy, starring Russ Abbot, Robert Fyfe and Juliette Kaplan.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney tries to help a drunken woman on the street, but his good deed backfires. Fearful of a life behind bars, he promptly goes into hiding - unaware devious brother Del has set him up as a joke. Comedy, starring Nicholas Lyndhurst and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: He Ain't Heavy, He's My Uncle.
programme.desc: Uncle Albert falls victim to muggers, so Del-Boy resolves to take the law into his own hands, while Rodney becomes a director in Trotters Independent Traders - and his first job is to give the car a good clean. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: Three Men, a Woman and a Baby.
programme.desc: Rodney and Albert begin to worry the flat will get overcrowded as the birth of Del-Boy Jr approaches, while Del feels well prepared for fatherhood thanks to a stint at antenatal classes with Raquel. Starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Smithy accompanies Nessa to the hospital for her first ultrasound scan, and the pair catch a glimpse of their baby. Stacey becomes unusually excited at the prospect of a weekend visit to her family home after she struggles to adjust to her role as an `Essex wife' - which proves to lack some of the glamour she had expected.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: After a day spent house-hunting, the newlyweds take up an invitation from Nessa and Smithy to relax with a trip to the bowling alley. However, when tensions between Gavin and Stacey reach a head at the end of the night, their two friends begin to regret making the offer.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Lee Nelson, Stewart Francis and Paul Chowdhry.
programme.desc: Cheeky Londoner Lee Nelson plays host for a `well good' session of stand-up from the Hammersmith Apollo in London, warming up the audience before introducing routines by Canadian funnyman Stewart Francis and observational comic Paul Chowdhry.(n)

programme.title: Peep Show
programme.desc: Mark makes a new friend at a business conference and Jeremy reluctantly considers accepting Super Hans as a replacement flatmate - but soon decides against it. Offbeat comedy, starring Robert Webb, Olivia Coleman and David Mitchell.(n)

programme.title: Little Britain
programme.desc: Roman's facial gets out of hand when estranged wife Bubbles interferes, and Dudley is shocked by Ting Tong's latest revelations, but cannot resist her tight green outfit. Orville is harassed in a supermarket and Marjorie Dawes gets star-struck when a celebrity addition to Fat Fighters arrives. Featuring guest appearances by Rob Brydon and former EastEnder Derek Martin (Charlie Slater).(n)

programme.title: French and Saunders
programme.desc: Skits and sketches from comedy duo Dawn and Jennifer, featuring a spoof of Western The Quick and the Dead. Guest starring Lenny Henry.(n)

programme.sub-title: Lee Nelson, Stewart Francis and Paul Chowdhry.

programme.title: Vic Reeves Big Night Out
programme.desc: The Living Carpets dine in Les' Lunch Club, Judge Nutmeg dishes out the punishment in That's Justice and The Man with the Stick continues to search for his kids. Surreal comedy, with Vic Reeves and Bob Mortimer.(n)

programme.title: Vic Reeves Big Night Out
programme.desc: Vic sees a new side to Wavy Davy, the Stotts present a film review and Graham Lister tries to take over.(n)

programme.title: Harry Hill's TV Burp
programme.desc: The Bafta-winning comedian reviews the week's TV highlights, subjecting the latest soaps, reality shows, documentaries and other assorted oddities to his unique brand of scrutiny.(n)

programme.desc: Sandy worries she has a stalker when she spots someone following her home at night. Lionel's efforts to calm the situation are unsuccessful, so Alistair steps in to help and manages to uncover the mysterious man's identity.(n)

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.sub-title: Beware the Trickster on the Roof.
programme.desc: The Meldrew household falls foul of an evil curse, so Victor resolves to remove it. However, it soon becomes clear the task is easier said than done. Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Rights of Man (Except for Howard).
programme.desc: Hobbo tells Howard to stand up for himself if he still wants Pearl to take him back - but his wife pours cold water on his attempts to impress her. Marina decides to seize the moment with Mr Waddle, and the police pull Tom over for driving too slowly, only to end up sharing his bacon sandwiches. Russ Abbot, Robert Fyfe and Juliette Kaplan star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: In a bid to persuade Pearl to take back her errant husband, Howard's friends try to convince her he is living as a tramp - but he is far from happy at the prospect of going it alone in the wilderness. Meanwhile, Toby's attempt to regain Monica's affections is thwarted by a dog, and Marina decides to dress down for a change. Comedy, starring Russ Abbot, Robert Fyfe and Juliette Kaplan.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Wondering if Pearl still loves him, Howard asks Hobbo to give her a peck on the cheek from him - only to become even more despondent when he sees his wife deliver a passionate kiss. Meanwhile, Glenda sends Barry off to paint a landscape, hoping the activity will distract him from his hunger - but fish and chips is the only thing on his mind. Comedy, starring Russ Abbot, Robert Fyfe and Juliette Kaplan.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch desperately wants to get out of the tedious task of making fishing nets, and hatches a crafty scheme to get himself assigned to the library. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: Three Men, a Woman and a Baby.
programme.desc: Rodney and Albert begin to worry the flat will get overcrowded as the birth of Del-Boy Jr approaches, while Del feels well prepared for fatherhood thanks to a stint at antenatal classes with Raquel. Starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del snatches a chance to make a quick profit, leaving gullible Denzil stripped of his redundancy money. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Sorry
programme.sub-title: One of Our Naughty Bits Is Missing.
programme.desc: Tim's decision to donate a book to the local men's ward is hampered by the neighbourhood tramp, and then by mother. Comedy, starring Ronnie Corbett and Barbara Lott.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch desperately wants to get out of the tedious task of making fishing nets, and hatches a crafty scheme to get himself assigned to the library. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: How Not to Cry at Weddings.
programme.desc: In the final episode of Roy Clarke's long-running comedy, everyone prepares for the wedding - prompting Howard and Pearl to look back at their relationship. Meanwhile, Alvin flirts with Stella, Toby tries to smarten himself up in a bid to win back Monica, and Clegg worries he has forgotten something important.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Lair of the Cat Creature.
programme.desc: A hang-gliding enthusiast crashes down in the village, mistakenly believing that he's landed in France, thus breaking the long-distance record. The gang tries to compensate for his disappointment by making him the best at something else - identifying a strange cat creature lurking in the woods. Peter Sallis, Frank Thornton and Brian Murphy star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Truly and Clegg are enlightened in the wisdom of the East by an electrical handyman from Hull, and Howard struggles to keep his self-styled bandit persona alive. Meanwhile, a debt-collector is an unwelcome guest for Tom.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del snatches a chance to make a quick profit, leaving gullible Denzil stripped of his redundancy money. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Smithy accompanies Nessa to the hospital for her first ultrasound scan, and the pair catch a glimpse of their baby. Stacey becomes unusually excited at the prospect of a weekend visit to her family home after she struggles to adjust to her role as an `Essex wife' - which proves to lack some of the glamour she had expected.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: After a day spent house-hunting, the newlyweds take up an invitation from Nessa and Smithy to relax with a trip to the bowling alley. However, when tensions between Gavin and Stacey reach a head at the end of the night, their two friends begin to regret making the offer.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright invents a saint's day as a pretext for checking the pockets of a foreign visitor suspected of shoplifting. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney tires of his role as junior partner in Trotters Independent Traders and decides to set up a rival business with best mate and would-be wide boy Mickey Pearce, hoping to give wheeler-dealer Del a run for his money. Nicholas Lyndhurst, David Jason and Patrick Murray star.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Julian Clary, Omid Djalili and Reginald D Hunter.
programme.desc: Host Omid Djalili warms up the audience before camp comic Julian Clary and Alabama's finest Reginald D Hunter take the mic at the Hammersmith Apollo in London.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Cathy seems reluctant to reveal any information about her new boyfriend, Mark refuses to talk about why his wife has thrown him out, and Dermot lies to his fiancee's parents about his job - all of which makes Agnes feel her family is becoming too secretive. Comedy, written by and starring Brendan O'Carroll.(n)
