programme.desc: Jeremy tries to impress Toni with his new job in a music studio, while Mark is disappointed at being passed over for promotion. Starring Robert Webb and David Mitchell.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Four of the eight chefs from yesterday's heat return to face a skills test in which they must each skin a whole Dover sole and cook a portion on the bone in 12 minutes. Michel Roux Jr then challenges them to prepare roast saddle of hare with red wine and mustard sauce from a basic recipe that contains no weights and measures. The contenders then prepare their own choice of dish to be judged by Michel and Monica Galetti, who pick three to advance to the quarter-final.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: From 2011, 12 enthusiastic home-cooks take part in a culinary contest devised by Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry to determine which of them is Britain's best amateur baker. In the first round, the competitors are challenged to make 24 decorated cupcakes in two hours, before being asked to bake a coffee and walnut Battenberg cake. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Six more amateur cooks compete for a place in tomorrow's quarter-final, preparing a plate of food that represents who they are as their Calling Card and choosing one box of ingredients - either sweet or savoury - to rustle up a surprise dish in the Invention Test, before two of the hopefuls are sent home. The remaining four serve dinner for 2011 and 2012 MasterChef champions Tim Anderson and Shelina Permalloo respectively, as well as 2008 finalist Jonny Stevenson, before judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace decide who has made it through.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore the food provided by British waterways as they fly-fish for trout, prepare a meal of stuffed wild duck and discover how the Gloucestershire tradition of eating baby eels has virtually disappeared.(n)

programme.title: Gordon's Great Escape
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads south to Kerala to try what is considered the ultimate seafood curry, and also spends time in an ashram in Tamil Nadu where all the food is vegetarian. After giving bullock racing a go, the chef finishes his journey in Mumbai, where he visits the city's slums and cooks with one of India's leading chefs for a star-studded dinner in a hotel.(n)

programme.title: Heston's Great British Food
programme.desc: Heston Blumenthal discovers the origins of the British roast and serves up beef with all the trimmings to the people who make it possible - butchers and farmers. The chef tries out a roast chicken dressed as a medieval knight riding a pig into battle, and uncovers just how important beef was to Admiral Nelson and his navy. He also travels to Switzerland to find out how mould is used in laboratories to create aged meat, before preparing a joint made up of different cuts, all treated differently, and stuck together with meat glue.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: From 2011, 12 enthusiastic home-cooks take part in a culinary contest devised by Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry to determine which of them is Britain's best amateur baker. The remaining four serve dinner for 2011 and 2012 MasterChef champions Tim Anderson and Shelina Permalloo respectively, as well as 2008 finalist Jonny Stevenson, before judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace decide who has made it through.(n)

programme.title: Simply Nigella
programme.desc: The food writer demonstrates her favourite recipes for sharing with family and friends, including a tray of nourishing breakfast bars, a supper of crunchy chicken cutlets, and a dark and sumptuous chocolate cake. Plus she shows to make succulent belly pork burgers, which were inspired by a visit to a New York eatery.(n)

programme.title: Rachel Khoo's Kitchen Notebook
programme.sub-title: Rachel Khoo's Kitchen Notebook: Cosmopolitan Cook: Amalfi Coast.
programme.desc: The Amalfi coastline is the next stop on the chef's culinary journey around Europe, as she cooks a family meal at a cliff-side restaurant, and learns the secrets to some delicious dishes.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The four chefs from Monday's heat who have yet to face their skills test are challenged by Monica Galetti and Gregg Wallace to prepare potato gnocchi and serve it with a garnish or sauce of their choice. They then recreate Michel Roux Jr's dish of roast John Dory with artichoke barigoule, as well as a classic dish of their own choosing, before Monica and Michel decide which three contestants will advance to the quarter-final.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The 11 remaining bakers are given the task of creating a quiche that reflects their personalities, before tackling the technical challenge - tarte au citron. The pressure proves too much for some, as they try to impress judges Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The second quarter-final sees the four heat winners take on the fiendishly difficult Palate Test, recreating John Torode's chicken liver pate with onions Madagascar and melba toast, having only had a couple of minutes to taste the food and write down what they think the ingredients are. They then cook a showstopping dish for the judges and critic Charles Campion - himself a former chef - and it had better be good, as for some of them, it will be their last time in the MasterChef kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Pacific Island Feasts with Peter Kuruvita
programme.desc: The host explores sustainability among fishing communities in the Philippines' Visayan Islands.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explain how necessity often forced cooks to make the most of limited ingredients to create tasty dishes. They reveal that many popular meals were invented during hard times, from mince and dumplings to Scotch broths.(n)

programme.title: Ottolenghi's Mediterranean Feast
programme.desc: Chef Yotam Ottolenghi travels the southern and eastern Mediterranean to explore its cuisine. He begins his journey in Marrakech, Morocco, tasting its wide variety of street food and soaking up the atmosphere of Jemaa el-Fna square, the city's largest communal dining area. Inspired, he returns to his rooftop kitchen and prepares a barbecued leg of lamb with almonds and orange blossom sauce, and herb-infused couscous with grilled cherry tomatoes, before meeting the Berbers, the country's indigenous people, in the Atlas Mountains.(n)

programme.title: Heston's Great British Food
programme.desc: Heston Blumenthal explores the history of the classic British pudding. He heads back to the early 1600s, when the way to make one was by stuffing the ingredients into an animal's intestine. The chef creates a rice pudding that looks like a hotdog, with a white chocolate mousse bun, pastry-fried onions, sweet soy sauce and saffron mustard, and makes a 17th-century pud involving a cow's udder. He also attempts a giant sponge pudding from the Victorian era and serves it to a specially invited group of teachers and dinner ladies.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The 11 remaining bakers are given the task of creating a quiche that reflects their personalities, before tackling the technical challenge - tarte au citron. The pressure proves too much for some, as they try to impress judges Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The second quarter-final sees the four heat winners take on the fiendishly difficult Palate Test, recreating John Torode's chicken liver pate with onions Madagascar and melba toast, having only had a couple of minutes to taste the food and write down what they think the ingredients are. They then cook a showstopping dish for the judges and critic Charles Campion - himself a former chef - and it had better be good, as for some of them, it will be their last time in the MasterChef kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Pacific Island Feasts with Peter Kuruvita
programme.desc: The host explores sustainability among fishing communities in the Philippines' Visayan Islands.(n)

programme.title: Simply Nigella
programme.desc: Food writer Nigella Lawson demonstrates dishes that combine the comfort of the familiar with the excitement of the new, including fluffy oat pancakes drizzled with a raspberry and honey syrup. She offers a twist on a classic Caesar salad for a light lunch idea, and rustles up a Greek-inspired supper for friends including squid and orzo pasta, and a sweet and savoury version of a cheesecake. Nigella's simple rice bowl with ginger, radish and avocado celebrates a few choice ingredients and results in a dish that's uplifting to look at, as well as to eat.(n)

programme.title: Rachel Khoo's Kitchen Notebook
programme.sub-title: Rachel Khoo's Kitchen Notebook: Cosmopolitan Cook: Costa Brava.
programme.desc: Along the Catalonian coastline, the chef uncovers some local foodie secrets, before she returns home to make leek parcels with a Romesco sauce.(n)

programme.title: Ottolenghi's Mediterranean Feast
programme.desc: Chef Yotam Ottolenghi travels the southern and eastern Mediterranean to explore its cuisine. He begins his journey in Marrakech, Morocco, tasting its wide variety of street food and soaking up the atmosphere of Jemaa el-Fna square, the city's largest communal dining area. Inspired, he returns to his rooftop kitchen and prepares a barbecued leg of lamb with almonds and orange blossom sauce, and herb-infused couscous with grilled cherry tomatoes, before meeting the Berbers, the country's indigenous people, in the Atlas Mountains.(n)

programme.title: Heston's Great British Food

He also attempts a giant sponge pudding from the Victorian era and serves it to a specially invited group of teachers and dinner ladies.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explain how necessity often forced cooks to make the most of limited ingredients to create tasty dishes. They reveal that many popular meals were invented during hard times, from mince and dumplings to Scotch broths.(n)

Las Vegas casino owner Donald P Sinclair (John Cleese) decides to set up a special event for his highest rollers. He'll make a killing on the bets placed on the players while the contestants (including Rowan Atkinson, Breckin Meyer, Amy Smart, Whoopi Goldberg and Cuba Gooding Jr) dash for the cash. Edited for language. M,W,R,S,(n)

programme.desc: Payne is the taunting psycho threatening LA with high explosives, Jack the agent who's close to catching him. When Payne loads a bus with bombs, Jack must evacuate the passengers while keeping the vehicle travelling at over 50mph. Thriller(n)

programme.title: Shaft
programme.desc: A slick, trigger-happy detective flouts the law as he goes on the hunt for a rich murderer whose power and influence could get him off the hook(n)

programme.title: Insecure
programme.desc: Insecure as F**k. Two black women who are best friends navigate the pitfalls of their personal and professional lives in south Los Angeles in this comedy, which begins with Issa wondering if her relationship with her boyfriend is still worth the effort, while Molly's success as an attorney barely masks her dissatisfaction with her romantic prospects(n)

programme.title: How to Be Single
programme.desc: Eligible young people in New York City search for romance while living the single life with their friends(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.desc: 06-25-2017. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: The Birth of a Nation
programme.desc: This historical drama recounts a real-life slave revolt that occurred in 1831 Virginia, led by a black preacher named Nat Turner. Turner is so appalled by the horrors he sees while sermonising that he is moved to fight back(n)

programme.title: Crossroads
programme.desc: Four years after they left school, three old pals team up for a road trip from Georgia to California. Mimi's got dreams of Hollywood, Kit's looking forward to seeing her beau, but Lucy wants escape...and maybe to find the mother she's never met(n)

programme.title: My Blue Heaven
programme.desc: Heartwarming comedy about an affable mafioso who turns state's evidence and becomes a kind of fairy godfather to the strait-laced FBI man assigned to guard him. For his protection, he is rehoused in a small town in the back of beyond. But before long he reverts to his old ways and is frequently arrested by a vigilant DA - a stressed mother of two whose life is also in need of a makeover(n)

programme.title: Blast From the Past
programme.desc: Brendan Fraser stars in this 'fish out of water' comedy. A young man struggles to come to terms with the modern world after emerging from a bunker where he's lived since 1962(n)

programme.title: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe
programme.desc: When young World War Two evacuee Lucy Pevensie hides in an old wardrobe during a game of hide and seek, she finds herself transported to the magical land of Narnia, locked in eternal winter by the evil White Witch. Her siblings do not believe her when she tells them of this strange new world, but they are soon in Narnia themselves, fighting alongside the noble lion Aslan to defeat the witch and her mighty army(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.desc: 06-25-2017. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: Real Sports With Bryant Gumbel
programme.desc: 06/20/2017. Segments include a look at the dwindling popularity of bullfighting in Spain; profiles of American tennis up-and-comer Frances Tiafoe and Paralympian and Mount Everest climber Jeff Glasbrenner; a visit with a young man working to chronicle and assist surviving Negro League players(n)

programme.title: Making of 'The Mummy'
programme.desc: A look at "The Mummy," a 2017 horror film about a cruel princess of ancient Egypt who wreaks havoc on humanity after she is accidentally resurrected. The film stars Tom Cruise, Sofia Boutella and Annabelle Wallis, and is directed by Alex Kurtzman(n)

programme.title: Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen
programme.desc: Two years after saving the world with the Autobots, Sam Witwicky is heading off to university when an ancient Decepticon named The Fallen returns to Earth seeking revenge. Their home planet of Cybertron rendered uninhabitable, the Autobots begin working with the military to hunt down any remaining Decepticons. Meanwhile, Sam and Mikaela race to unlock the secret history of the Transformers on Earth in order to save the planet from the most-formidable Decepticon to date(n)

programme.title: Krampus
programme.desc: While Santa Claus rewards good children with gifts on Christmas, Krampus, a beast-like creature with demonic appearance, seeks out naughty children and punishes them(n)

programme.title: Real Time With Bill Maher
programme.sub-title: Maajid Nawaz; Richard Painter; Bianna Golodryga; Charlie Sykes; Bradley Whitford
programme.desc: Maajid Nawaz; Richard Painter; Bianna Golodryga; Charlie Sykes; Bradley Whitford. Counter-extremism expert Maajid Nawaz and attorney Richard Painter are the interview guests. The panelists are journalist Bianna Golodryga, political commentator Charlie Sykes and actor Bradley Whitford(n)

programme.title: Vice News Tonight
programme.desc: Episode 156. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: Mike and Dave Need Wedding Dates
programme.desc: Two hard-partying ladies see a viral video in which unruly brothers plead for dates for their sister's wedding in Hawaii, and decide to pose as the angels they're looking for in order to score a free trip in this incredibly raunchy comedy(n)

programme.title: Veep
programme.desc: Groundbreaking. In the Season 6 finale, Selina and her staff get ready for the long-awaited groundbreaking for her library; Amy seeks clarity on her role; and Jonah asks Dan, Ben and Kent for help(n)

programme.title: Straight Outta Compton
programme.desc: Electrifying chronicle of the seminal rap group N.W.A. and their 'hood-to-riches success, tracing their story from the mean streets of mid-'80s Compton to their triumphant battles against censorship(n)

programme.title: WCB: Ward vs. Kovalev 2
programme.desc: Light-heavyweight champ Andre Ward vs. Sergey Kovalev in a rematch in Las Vegas. Ward took the title from Kovalev last November by winning a hard-fought decision, with all three scorers giving him a 114-113 advantage(n)

programme.title: Real Sports With Bryant Gumbel
programme.desc: 06/20/2017. Segments include a look at the dwindling popularity of bullfighting in Spain; profiles of American tennis up-and-comer Frances Tiafoe and Paralympian and Mount Everest climber Jeff Glasbrenner; a visit with a young man working to chronicle and assist surviving Negro League players(n)

programme.title: Krampus
programme.desc: While Santa Claus rewards good children with gifts on Christmas, Krampus, a beast-like creature with demonic appearance, seeks out naughty children and punishes them(n)

programme.title: Steel
programme.desc: Action-packed adventure about a military scientist who takes to the streets as a hi-tech crusader when his work on a formidable new weapon is hijacked. When a version of his weapon - which neutralises enemies without killing them - starts appearing in the outside world, he dons a special suit and transforms himself into a cartoon-style superhero known as 'Steel'(n)

programme.title: Rat Race
programme.desc: (2001) Gag-meister Jerry Zucker's cracking comedy has a cast to die for. Las Vegas casino owner Donald P Sinclair (John Cleese) decides to set up a special event for his highest rollers. Lucky tokens in his slot machines entitle six punters to enter a race across America with $2million as the prize. He'll make a killing on the bets placed on the players while the contestants (including Rowan Atkinson, Breckin Meyer, Amy Smart, Whoopi Goldberg and Cuba Gooding Jr) dash for the cash. Edited for language. M,W,R,S,(n)

programme.title: Catch Me if You Can
programme.desc: A true story about Frank Abagnale Jr., who, before his 19th birthday, fraudulently obtained millions of dollars in cheques while posing as a Pan Am pilot, doctor, and legal prosecutor(n)

programme.title: The Fight Game With Jim Lampley
programme.desc: 06/14/2017. An interview with Sergey Kovalev; a breakdown of the Andre Ward-Kovalev rematch; a recap of Terence Crawford's New York fight; and a look back at the David Tua vs. Ike Ibeabuchi 1997 heavyweight bout(n)

programme.title: Just Married
programme.desc: Goofy Tom and rich kid Sarah head to Venice on honeymoon. He's worried about her ex, who has followed them; she's concerned that Tom only wants to watch TV. Either way, they're unlikely to make it home together(n)

programme.title: The Trans List
programme.desc: Notable transgender individuals, including Caitlyn Jenner, Caroline Cossey, Buck Angel, and Laverne Cox, are interviewed. They candidly discuss their experiences and what it means to be transgender. One in a series of grouped interview documentaries by director Timothy Greenfield-Sanders(n)

programme.title: August Rush
programme.desc: Wonderfully rewarding urban fairy tale about a 12-year-old prodigy (the marvelous Freddie Highmore) who heads to New York City to find and reunite with the musician parents who abandoned him as a baby. Keri Russell and Jonathan Rhys Meyers costar as the young lovebirds who made sweet music (and a child) before their romance was dramatically and untimely cut short. Directed by Kirsten Sheridan. Robin Williams is a gas as a modern-day Fagin trying to "help" the lad in his quest(n)

programme.title: Get Smart
programme.desc: The spy spoof series gets the big screen treatment with this action comedy starring Steve Carell and Anne Hathaway. Agents 86 (Carell), 99 (Hathaway), and 23 (Dwayne 'The Rock' Johnson) lead Control against the evil entity KAOS(n)

programme.title: The Legend of Tarzan
programme.desc: Years after leaving the jungle and settling down with his wife Jane in London, Tarzan returns to the Congo to act as a trade representative for England. However, he soon clashes with a greedy Belgian captain who has sinister plans for his old home(n)

programme.title: Vice News Tonight
programme.desc: Episode 157. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: Rush Hour 3
programme.desc: Brett Ratner's martial-arts action-comedy sequel starring Chris Tucker and Jackie Chan. When the Chinese Ambassador to the US is shot while in the act of divulging the whereabouts of a major Triad leader, the American authorities once more send Chief Inspector Lee and Detective James Carter into the fray. Lee quickly corners the would-be assassin, Kenji, but the shock of coming face-to-face with an old friend gives the baddie just enough time to escape. Kenji's trail leads the mismatched cops to Paris, where car chases and a sequence among the under-dressed dancers of the Folies Bergère await them, plus rather a lot of dodgy French stereotypes and a finale atop the Eiffel Tower(n)

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: Server Error. In the Series 4 finale, Richard's caught in a web of lies in a last-ditch attempt to save Pied Piper. Meanwhile, Jared plans his exit when he's worried about Richard's future; Jack tries to change the narrative; and Gavin plots his comeback(n)

programme.title: If You're Not in the Obit, Eat Breakfast
programme.desc: Carl Reiner seeks out some of his nonagenarian friends, including Norman Lear, Mel Brooks, Betty White, Dick Van Dyke, Stan Lee and Iris Apfel—and even a few centenarian ones—to discuss the secrets of their longevity and still-active lifestyles. Tony Bennett performs the film's opening title song, "The Best Is Yet to Come."(n)

programme.title: Flight of the Conchords
programme.desc: NewZealandTown. The grand opening of a New Zealand district in New York finds Bret and Jemaine distracted by their physical appearances(n)

programme.title: Race
programme.desc: In this exhilarating drama based on true events, legendary black Olympian Jesse Owens competes in track and field at the 1936 Games in Nazi Germany, despite the host country's attempts to turn the event into a celebration of Aryan supremacy(n)

programme.title: The Cider House Rules
programme.desc: John Irving won an Oscar for this moving, thoughtful drama, an adaptation of his own novel, starring Tobey Maguire and Michael Caine (who also picked up a statue). Maguire plays Homer Wells, an orphan mentored by Dr Wilbur Larch. Larch runs the orphanage Homer grew up in, but Homer baulks at his sideline in illegal abortions. And after young couple Candy and Wally come to Larch for a termination, Homer returns home with them. After Wally is posted overseas on war duty, Homer and Candy become closer at the cider house where they work; but news of a fellow worker's pregnancy leads Homer to re-examine his principles. Directed by Lasse Hallström(n)

programme.title: Now You See Me 2
programme.desc: In this sequel, illusionists known as the Four Horsemen return to perform a spectacular stunt in the hopes of clearing their name and exposing the unscrupulous behavior of a tech mogul(n)

programme.title: Demolition
programme.desc: Davis Mitchell (Jake Gyllenhaal) has a comfortable life as a Wall Street investment banker, but it's brought to an abrupt halt when his wife is killed in a car accident. As he struggles to move on from this tragedy, he reflects on the stagnant marriage he had with his late spouse. He also becomes obsessed with dismantling the machines surrounding him as a coping mechanism, and begins a relationship with a customer-service representative for a vending-machine company (Naomi Watts) after sending them multiple complaint letters. Director Jean-Marc Vallée directed this black dramedy, which made its world premiere at the 2015 Toronto International Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Rushmore
programme.desc: Jason Schwartzman stars as troubled student Max Fischer, competing with grumpy Bill Murray for the love of a beautiful teacher(n)

programme.title: The Conjuring
programme.desc: Suspecting their new house may be haunted, a distressed couple call in a pair of top paranormal experts to investigate(n)

programme.title: Making of 'All Eyez on Me'
programme.desc: A look at "All Eyez on Me," a 2017 biopic of legendary rapper Tupac Shakur that chronicles his rise to fame and untimely death at the age of 25. The film stars Demetrius Shipp Jr., Danai Gurira and Lauren Cohan, and is directed by Benny Boom(n)

programme.title: Vice
programme.desc: Cyber Supremacy & Japan Rising. Ben Ferguson travels to Tel Aviv to see how Israel is leading the way on cybersecurity; Gianna Toboni reports on a right-wing movement in Japan to revive and strengthen its military might(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.desc: 06-25-2017. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: The Last Witch Hunter
programme.desc: An immortal witch hunter faces off against the Witch Queen, who has returned from the dead, in a battle where the fate of humanity hangs in the balance(n)

programme.title: Real Time With Bill Maher
programme.sub-title: Maajid Nawaz; Richard Painter; Bianna Golodryga; Charlie Sykes; Bradley Whitford
programme.desc: Maajid Nawaz; Richard Painter; Bianna Golodryga; Charlie Sykes; Bradley Whitford. Counter-extremism expert Maajid Nawaz and attorney Richard Painter are the interview guests. The panelists are journalist Bianna Golodryga, political commentator Charlie Sykes and actor Bradley Whitford(n)

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: Server Error. In the Series 4 finale, Richard's caught in a web of lies in a last-ditch attempt to save Pied Piper. Meanwhile, Jared plans his exit when he's worried about Richard's future; Jack tries to change the narrative; and Gavin plots his comeback(n)

programme.title: Live Free or Die Hard
programme.desc: An old-fashioned cop emerges to foil a high-tech attack on the country's computer infrastructure as Bruce Willis brings back one of the biggest action franchises in screen history. It's been over a decade since audiences last saw New York cop John McClane (Willis), but now, as the world's greatest criminal mastermind (Timothy Olyphant) attempts to cripple the entire country with an innovative act of technological terrorism, only one cop can insure that the integrity of the system stays intact. In this, the fourth installment of the long-running action series, Underworld director Len Wiseman picks up the torch formerly carried by directors John McTiernan and Renny Harlin to helm a script penned by Mark Bomback(n)

programme.title: T.J. Miller Meticulously Ridiculous
programme.desc: Comedian T.J. Miller performs in Denver at the Paramount Theatre. Topics include nightmares; the differences between alcohol and marijuana; his favorite figure from history; and the challenges of talking about death(n)

programme.title: Good Will Hunting
programme.desc: Working as a janitor, maths genius Will Hunting is struggling to find direction in his life, until a dedicated psychologist helps him come to terms with his gift(n)

programme.title: End of Days
programme.desc: Inane apocalyptic action-thriller starring Arnold Schwarzenegger as an ex-cop who tries to foil Satan's plan to conquer the world on New Year's Eve 1999(n)

programme.title: Screwed
programme.desc: Scott Alexander and Larry Karaszewski, who scripted "Ed Wood" and "Man on the Moon," co-directed and co-wrote this frenetic farce about a chauffeur (Norm Macdonald) who steers into big trouble when he kidnaps the pooch of his wealthy, tyrannical boss (Elaine Stritch). Danny DeVito, Dave Chappelle, Daniel Benzali, Sherman Hemsley, Sarah Silverman, Malcolm Stewart(n)

programme.title: Meet the Donors: Does Money Talk?
programme.desc: Alexandra Pelosi looks at money in politics and interviews wealthy donors to Republican and Democratic parties to ask them about their contributions and philosophies. Also: a look at efforts to enact campaign-finance reform(n)

programme.title: Lady in the Water
programme.desc: In this mesmerizing horror fantasy, an apartment manager finds a sea nymph called a "narf" in the complex's swimming pool, and tries to return her to her natural habitat. However, otherworldly monsters are out to stop him(n)

programme.title: The Wizard of Lies
programme.desc: Adaptation of journalist Diana B. Henriques' account of financier Bernie Madoff's orchestration of one of the largest frauds in U.S. history that led to financial ruin for thousands of investors and, in the process, his own family's destruction(n)

programme.title: Resident Evil
programme.desc: Alice leads a team of commandos into the multi-national Umbrella Corporation's locked-down bunker, which is controlled by the main computer, The Red Queen. The unit is sealed because of a virus that gassed all the staff but, as Alice and her team discover, the virus has re-animated them. Now, as well as facing the computer's weaponry, they must tackle the living dead to prevent the virus escaping into the outside world. Paul W Anderson's horror thriller is based on the successful computer game(n)

programme.title: Jason Bourne
programme.desc: Now fully recovered from his amnesia, former CIA assassin Jason Bourne attempts to uncover the truth behind his father's death, while simultaneously exacting revenge and evading the government forces hot on his trail(n)

programme.title: Scream 2
programme.desc: A brilliant and brutal masked serial killer terrorises Sidney (Neve Campbell) and her quiet hometown in this darkly humorous and utterly terrifying thriller from Wes Craven(n)

programme.title: Unbreakable
programme.desc: Haunting comic book story of a train crash survivor who realises that he has never been hurt and befriends his opposite, a man who has never been free from injury(n)

programme.title: Veep
programme.desc: Groundbreaking. In the Season 6 finale, Selina and her staff get ready for the long-awaited groundbreaking for her library; Amy seeks clarity on her role; and Jonah asks Dan, Ben and Kent for help(n)

programme.title: Next Friday
programme.desc: Hilarious follow up to Friday. Now it's Next Friday and Craig is still living with his parents in South Central Los Angeles while looking for a job and remembering his moment of glory four years earlier, when he finally beat local bully, Debo . But now Debo has escaped from prison and is looking to exact revenge on Craig. Craig's dad takes him to Rancho Cucamonga to hide out with his Uncle Elroy and cousin Day-Day, who have moved to the suburbs after winning the lottery. Getting together a couple of accomplices -- Phyllis (Geena Davis), who admires Grimm for his audacity, and Loomis (Randy Quaid), a follower to Grimm's leader since grade school -- Grimm decides to rob a bank, pocket the money, get out of town and take off to tropical splendor. Dressing in a clown suit, Grimm devises a unique way to rob a bank -- taking a group of hostages at the bank and inviting the police to surround the bank. Amazingly, although pursued by a police chief (Jason Robards), the trio manage to pull off the robbery. programme.desc: (1995) Steven Seagal returns as former Navy SEAL Casey Ryback in Geoff Murphy's action thriller. Ryback is taking a train holiday from Denver to Los Angeles with his recently orphaned teenage niece (Katherine Heigl) when their break is rudely interrupted by a megalomaniac terrorist. The baddie in question is Travis Dane (Eric Bogosian), who has gained control of the terrifyingly potent, space-based super weapon that he helped design. After being sacked by the US government, he's thrown his lot in with a shady Middle Eastern organisation that's out to destroy the eastern seaboard of the United States. Dane's team of merciless thugs take control of the train, from where the destructive satellite can be operated without detection, as long as the locomotive doesn't stop. But they're not counting on the wily ex-serviceman, nor his resolve to keep his niece safe from harm(n)

programme.title: The Kid Stays in the Picture
programme.desc: Robert Evans' rise from second-string actor (who really was discovered while lounging by the pool at the Beverly Hills Hotel) to head of one of Hollywood's biggest movie studios is told from the viewpoint of Evans himself in this documentary, adapted from his autobiography (and featuring Evans' own narration). In 1957, Evans had already achieved success in the garment business when actress Norma Shearer spotting him at poolside and suggested he should play her late husband, legendary producer Irving Thalberg, in the movie Man of a Thousand Faces. While Evans knew he wasn't cut out to be an actor, he discovered he liked the movie business, and after becoming a film industry executive, Evans was named head of production at Paramount in the late '60s. Under Evans' leadership, Paramount produced such classics as Rosemary's Baby, Love Story, and The Godfather. He also married actress Ali McGraw; however, McGraw left Evans for Steve McQueen after they starred together in The Getaway. After leaving Paramount to become a producer (and racking up hits like Chinatown and Marathon Man), Evans' golden touch began to elude him; an arrest for drugs seemed to put an end to his career, until he made a comeback as a freelance producer in the 1990s on such films as Sliver and The Saint. Part of the narration for The Kid Stays in the Picture was drawn from the book-on-tape version of Robert Evans' autobiography of the same name, which featured Evans reading his own work; the audio book has developed a cult following of its own, and legend has it Dustin Hoffman based his performance in Wag The Dog on Evans' reading style on the tape(n)

programme.title: If You're Not in the Obit, Eat Breakfast
programme.desc: Carl Reiner seeks out some of his nonagenarian friends, including Norman Lear, Mel Brooks, Betty White, Dick Van Dyke, Stan Lee and Iris Apfel—and even a few centenarian ones—to discuss the secrets of their longevity and still-active lifestyles. programme.title: Mega Disasters
programme.desc: San Francisco Earthquake. By the dawn of the 20th century, San Francisco had evolved into one of the most booming metropolises in North America, with commerce, trade, manufacturing, arts and culture at meteoric levels. But an event that struck the city at 5:12am on April 18, 1906 wrought such cataclysmic devastation that it threatened to bring all of this toppling down. The San Francisco Earthquake checked in as one of the most severe quakes in the history of North America; at least 3,000 deaths occurred (with many unreported at the time), fires broke out, buildings crumbled, and the total devastation exceeded $6 billion in early 21st century dollars. As produced for the History Channel documentary series Mega Disasters, this program recounts that terrifying catastrophe, supplemented by vintage photographs of the disaster, and CG-animation speculating on similar crises that may lie ahead thanks to the instability of the Californian seismic faults(n)

programme.title: After Armageddon

programme.title: Kick-Ass
programme.desc: Adapted from Mark Millar's hyper-violent comic book of the same name, director Matthew Vaughn's (Layer Cake) vigilante superhero film tells the tale of an average New York teenager who decides to don a costume and fight crime. Comic book geek Dave Lizewski (Aaron Johnson) may not have good coordination or special powers, but that doesn't mean he isn't a fully capable crime fighter. After purchasing a flashy wet suit on the Internet, Dave starts busting up baddies with nothing but brute force. He calls himself Kick-Ass, and he can take a beating as good as he can dish one out. Before long, Kick-Ass has become a local sensation, and others are following his lead. Big Daddy (Nicolas Cage) and Hit-Girl (Chloe Moretz) are a father-daughter crime-fighting duo who have set their sights on local mob heavy Frank D'Amico (Mark Strong). They're doing a decent job of dismantling Frank's sizable underworld empire when Kick-Ass gets drawn into the fray. But Frank's men play rough, and his son, Chris (Christopher Mintz-Plasse), is about to become Kick-Ass' very first arch nemesis. When Chris assumes the persona of Red Mist, the stage is set for a superhero showdown that could spell the end of Kick-Ass once and for all(n)

programme.title: Bad Boys
programme.desc: Marcus (Martin Lawrence) & Mike (Will Smith) are best friends & detectives. $100 million of heroin is stolen from a secure police vault. It's their job to find the drugs & protect the only witness..(n)

programme.title: Liar Liar
programme.desc: Another fun comedy for the Jim Carrey fans, 'Liar Liar' brings the star as Fletcher Reed, a successful lawyer who has built his career by lying. A divorced father, Fletcher has always given precedence to his job until on his son's eight birthday party ' that he had sworn he would attend -, Fletcher makes up such a lame excuse that when it comes time to blow out the candles, the boy makes a wish: that his dad could go just one day without telling a lie. The wish comes true but Fletcher's new compulsion for only saying the truth will make his next day in court very interesting(n)

Unfortunately, mad scientist Jonathan Reiss is also after the box willing to open it as his ultimate weapon. programme.title: Die Hard 2
programme.desc: "Another basement, another elevator...how can the same thing happen to the same guy twice?" asks John McClane (Bruce Willis), in what is doubtless the key question of this film. A year after foiling the terrorist takeover of a high-rise office building in the first movie, McClane is waiting to pick up his wife, Holly (Bonnie Bedelia), at Dulles International Airport just outside Washington, D.C., on Christmas Eve. Scheduled to arrive the same evening is Ramon Esperanza (Franco Nero), a South American political figure who is being brought to the United States to stand trial for his role in a drug-smuggling ring. However, a group of terrorists, led by renegade American military officer Col. Stuart (William Sadler), take control of the airport, scuttling radio transmissions and placing their own men in the control tower. Stuart and his men ensure that Esperanza's plane lands safely, and then demand that Stuart and his men be given a fully-fueled 747 and free passage wherever they choose to go. Otherwise, they will guide the many circling jets waiting for landing instructions into definite crash landings, killing the many passengers on board. Not willing to stand aside as terrorists once again threaten his wife's life, the wise-cracking McClane once again leaps into action to foil Stuart's plans and bring the passenger jets safely to the ground. William Atherton, John Amos, Dennis Franz, and John Leguizamo highlight the supporting cast(n)

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a woman is drowned in a bath and made to look like a bride, with a chilling lipstick message on the bathroom mirror, it triggers a spate of ghoulish wedding-themed murders in Great Worthy. The case takes Barnaby and Jones to a donkey sanctuary, a heritage steam railway and a pub run by an ex-policeman and former brothel madam as they try to identify the killer. Guest starring Pam Ferris (Rosemary & Thyme) and Kacey Ainsworth (formerly EastEnders' Little Mo).(n)

programme.title: Holiday Horrors: Caught on Camera

programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.(n)

programme.title: Live 2017 FIFA Confederations Cup
programme.desc: Portugal v Chile (Kick-off 7.00pm). Mark Pougatch presents coverage of the opening semi-final from Kazan Arena in Russia. Both of these teams remain unbeaten in the tournament so far, with Portugal having topped Group A with a record of two wins and one draw, while one victory and two stalemates was enough for Chile to finish second in Group B behind Germany. Arsenal star Alexis Sanchez recently became the all-time leading scorer for Chile when he notched the opening goal in a 1-1 with the Germans on matchday two, and will be looking to create more headlines in this encounter and lead the South Americans to the final. With analysis from Lee Dixon, and commentary by Clive Tyldesley and Glenn Hoddle. Subsequent programmes subject to change.(n)

programme.title: Holiday Horrors: Caught on Camera

programme.sub-title: The Cube: Celebrity Special: Rob Beckett and Rufus Hound.
programme.desc: Phillip Schofield invites comedians Rob Beckett and Rufus Hound to take part in a charity edition of the nerve-racking game show. Both are challenged to complete up to seven seemingly simple tasks of skill, dexterity, reaction, wit and wisdom within the confines of a large transparent cube. But each celebrity has only nine lives - and with each one they lose, the pressure mounts to win the jackpot of £250,000 for their chosen causes. Phillip Schofield is on hand to provide words of encouragement.(n)

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh heads to Bideford in Devon, where Tamsyn and Alex Wood's lives have been turned upside down in the last three years. Having emigrated to the south of France with their four children, they were forced to return to the UK after Alex suffered a brain injury followed by two haemorrhages. Alan sets his team the challenge of transforming the Woods' garden into a coastal haven, inspired by Alex's passion for surfing and the home's proximity to the sea. David Domoney upcycles a boat to create a bespoke daybed, Katie Rushworth turns old fruit barrels into raised planters and Frances Tophill introduces swathes of hardy flowers mixed in with paths of shingle.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat

Rural drama, starring Derek Fowlds and William Simons.(n)

programme.desc: A man is found shot dead in a hotel room and the cash he was carrying has gone missing. Ronnie and Sam discover the victim owed his ex-wife thousands of pounds in child support for their terminally ill son and had been lying to his girlfriend about his line of work. As the investigation progresses, the detectives focus their inquiries on the child's grandfather. Did he commit murder to recoup the unpaid money or is there more to this family set-up than first appears? Meanwhile, at the Crown Prosecution Service, Kate and Jake work out their differences. Guest starring Ian Bleasdale (Casualty).(n)

Alan plans to give her a peaceful retreat outside her back door with flavours of Africa and the Caribbean, as well as more than a splash of purple, her favourite colour. programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Jenny and Dennis are forced to cut short their honeymoon in Spain, and Gina grows increasingly unhappy at the thought of having to give up her job as pub licensee to marry a policeman. Ventress creates a bad impression at the station, and a crooked travel agent finds a way of cashing in on local holiday-makers' absence, while Vernon organises a Bentley owners' rally at the hall. Sarah Tansey and Duncan Bell star.(n)

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Nurse Stella Davenport arrives at the Royal with a less than favourable reputation, and soon causes a stir among the staff and patients as rumours about her circulate the hospital. Matron and Harper discover a new approach to interviewing when they try to fill a ward domestic vacancy, while Dr Ormerod is left to deal with the dramatic aftermath of a domestic dispute, and Lizzie realises her new scooter might have been an ill-advised purchase. Medical drama starring Natalie Anderson, Robert Daws and Wendy Craig.(n)

programme.title: Wild at Heart
programme.desc: Danny and Alice find their plans for a romantic getaway ruined when Rowan and Vanessa come along for the ride. Worse is in store when they arrive at the scene of an accident, where a tourist has severe injuries and a fearsome lion has escaped from a truck. With their own vehicle damaged, they face a long night stranded in the Bush, and there are more problems ahead when Rowan goes missing. Drama, starring Stephen Tompkinson, Dawn Steele, Cal Macaninch and Mary-Anne Barlow.(n)

programme.title: Man About the House
programme.desc: Chrissy discovers she has an admirer, while Mr Roper thinks his wife is seeing someone else. Comedy series, with Richard O'Sullivan and Brian Murphy.(n)

programme.title: Rising Damp
programme.desc: Rigsby splashes out on a new sports car in the hope of impressing Miss Jones, but a cruel practical joke by Philip convinces him he has run over his feline friend Vienna. Leonard Rossiter and Frances de la Tour star.(n)

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: Cash-strapped George knows exactly what he can sell to raise money - but decides not to tell Mildred. Comedy, starring Brian Murphy and Yootha Joyce.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Jenny and Dennis are forced to cut short their honeymoon in Spain, and Gina grows increasingly unhappy at the thought of having to give up her job as pub licensee to marry a policeman. Sarah Tansey and Duncan Bell star.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica joins forces with a Russian detective to solve a case of art theft and murder at a book fair in Miami. Whodunit, guest starring David Ogden Stiers and Andrew Robinson.(n)

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: When psychologist Reuben Beatty is murdered while moonlighting as a psychic, Lewis and Hathaway struggle to unravel the victim's baffling double life. Dark forces appear to be at work, and not just in the afterlife. Sanjeev Bhaskar guest stars, with Kevin Whately, Laurence Fox, Clare Holman and Rebecca Front.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: Ronnie and Sam lead the investigation into the death of a wealthy woman whose body was dumped in the Thames. The team initially focuses inquiries on the victim's abusive ex-husband, with whom she had been involved in a bitter struggle over custody of their daughter Holly, but the case heads in a different direction when the detectives discover the teenager was infatuated with her mother's new partner. With Patrick Baladi and an appearance by Bradley Walsh's son Barney.(n)

programme.title: Inspector Morse
programme.desc: The badly beaten body of 18-year-old clerk Sylvia Kane is found in a pub car park by her boyfriend John Sanders. Called in to investigate, Morse finds a coded letter in her bag and sets about trying to decipher it, gradually unravelling a tangled web of hidden passion and corruption at the insurance office where she worked. John Thaw and Kevin Whately star, with Anthony Bate, Terrence Hardiman, Jill Baker, Holly Aird and Ingrid Lacey.(n)

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: Arthur is repaid a debt in dodgy £20 notes, but by the time it comes to light they are counterfeit his creditor is heading on a flight to India. Once the Winchester is pinpointed as the source of the forged currency, Arthur also finds he has Chisholm breathing down his neck. Robbie Coltrane and Art Malik guest star, with George Cole and Patrick Malahide.(n)

programme.title: Cash Cowboys
programme.desc: Sheldon Smithens plays auctioneer when fellow antiques expert Scott Cozens decides to sell the entire collection of treasures in his man cave.(n)

programme.title: The Saint
programme.desc: Templar investigates the suspicious deaths of five company directors, who each received a card with the words `The Scales of Justice' printed on it prior to their demise. However, he finds his inquiries frustrated by the remaining members of the board. Roger Moore stars.(n)

programme.title: Ironside
programme.desc: One of Ironside's acquaintances is charged with murder, but the evidence seems somewhat contrived, and it appears someone may be trying to frame the Chief's friend.(n)

programme.title: Quincy ME
programme.desc: The medical examiner involves himself in a controversial manslaughter case during a fishing holiday, but encounters hostility from the residents of the resort. Jack Klugman stars.(n)

programme.title: Minder
programme.sub-title: A Number of Old Wives' Tales.
programme.desc: Apparently successful entrepreneur Clive Cosgrove loses his `confidence' after Arthur and Terry attend his wedding celebrations. Vintage comedy drama, guest starring Patrick Mower, with George Cole and Dennis Waterman.(n)

programme.title: Cycling
programme.desc: Action from the men's and women's races and time-trials on the Isle of Man.(n)

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A rare signed picture of the Rolling Stones piques the team's interest. The boys also appraise a Honda Pilot ATV. Reality programme chronicling the daily activities at the World Famous Gold & Silver Pawn Shop in Las Vegas.(n)

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys examine some sex education records from 1948 and a Las Vegas sheriff's department handbook.(n)

programme.title: Benidorm
programme.desc: Following CEO Crystal's whirlwind visit, a dejected, jobless Joyce tries to relax by the pool, but her morning is ruined when the new manager reinstates Jason Gallagher (former Brookside star Philip Olivier) at the bar. And when Janey and Jason find a letter offering Joyce a new job, they formulate a despicable plan. Elsewhere, the Oracle opens up to Noreen while trapped in a lift with his mum for the day, but who will take advantage of his predicament to make a move on Ionela? Clive falls victim to a dishonest holiday-home saleswoman and her accomplice. With Nadia Sawalha (Celebrity Big Brother) and John Challis (Only Fools and Horses' Boycie).(n)

programme.title: The Road
programme.desc: The world is devastated by a cataclysm that wipes out all the plants and animals and leaves the few remaining humans desperately struggling to survive. A man and his son make an arduous journey across a desolate America inhabited by cannibals, in search of sanctuary further south. Drama based on Cormac McCarthy's novel, starring Viggo Mortensen, Kodi Smit-McPhee, Charlize Theron, Robert Duvall and Guy Pearce.(n)

programme.title: The Football Mavericks

Thriller, starring Bruce Willis, Mos Def, David Morse, Jenna Stern and Casey Sander.(n)

Rural medical drama, starring Gary Mavers, Haydn Gwynne and Nick Stringer.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Elizabeth longs for a baby, but Lawrence is incapable of consummating their marriage and asks Sir Edwin Partridge to step in and help save it. Nicola Pagett and Gordon Jackson star.(n)

programme.desc: The team plan a farewell party for Robert on his final day at St Vic's, but Christine is in the doldrums at the prospect of him leaving and can't bring herself to share Jack's enthusiasm for their wedding. Sam is mortified to learn James has paid off the drug dealers and their relationship is left dead in the water when his pregnant wife turns up unannounced at Robert's party. Martin Shaw, Niamh Cusack and Michael Kitchen star. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Kate is confronted by a young pregnant village girl while practising as a partner with the elderly local GP. Nick takes a call saying that a flasher has been sighted on the moors. Nick Berry stars.(n)

programme.title: The Grand
programme.desc: A couple plan to open a newly refurbished hotel, but finances are tight and the only person who can bail them out demands a high price. Period drama, starring Mark McGann.(n)

programme.title: Mapp and Lucia
programme.desc: Georgie and Lucia decide they need a break from Riseholme, and rent houses in picturesque Tilling for the summer. However, before she can settle in their new location Lucia has to head back to Riseholme to take over organising its village fete. Whimsical drama, starring Geraldine McEwan, Prunella Scales and Nigel Hawthorne.(n)

programme.title: Robin of Sherwood

programme.title: Heartbeat

programme.desc: Elizabeth spends Christmas apart from Lawrence, confessing her sorrows to her parents, but a surprise lies in store for the Bellamys. Meanwhile, tension brews between Hudson and Thomas. Nicola Pagett and Gordon Jackson star.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Robert shocks his partner Issy by revealing that he's prepared to pack in work to help look after their new baby, while in her boss's absence, Christine's professional judgement is tested when a burns victim faces almost certain death. With Martin Shaw and Niamh Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth is called in to investigate when the UK's prime minister and his secretary are kidnapped in France. However, he has only a day and a half to solve the case before an important conference is set to take place. Drama, starring David Suchet.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The dapper Belgian sleuth receives several anonymous letters outlining a killer's intention to murder a succession of people in alphabetical order, prompting him to try to unmask the culprit before the body-count mounts. Crime drama based on the Agatha Christie novel, starring David Suchet, with Pippa Guard, Donald Sumpter and Miranda Forbes.(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective delves into the past of extreme sports enthusiast Gideon Frane after he plunges from a cliff in a ball of flames. A scan of the files reveals a long list of stalking complaints against an ex, and an anonymous letter to the victim spelling out Burn in Hell is linked to one of her friends. Aided by DC Shepherd and the newly appointed DC Edwards, the team tries to track down Gideon's old gang to uncover a lifetime of bullying and an unexpected story of rough justice.(n)

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: As Gary Bell waits for news about whether he will be offered a reprieve, Geordie and Phil discover a reason to arrest Eddie Jones, a violent husband who beats his wife. However, when Sidney arrives at the station the following morning, he finds Geordie with his knuckles bruised and Eddie dead on a stretcher. Chief Inspector Benson questions his innocence, and although the vicar leaps to his friend's defence, no one can verify his whereabouts when Eddie was killed. At the vicarage, a remark about Mrs Maguire's love life and the accidental loss of some sentimental postcards leave the housekeeper and Leonard feeling raw and misunderstood.(n)

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: When Sidney's old friend Reverend Sam Milburn visits the parish claiming to be seeking forgiveness for his crimes, the vicar is torn. Matters complicate further when Harding Redmond finds out he has returned and makes threats against his life, and Sam flees. With his friend now missing, Sidney fears the worst and must once again join forces with Geordie to investigate. Meanwhile, Leonard continues to wrestle with his feelings for Daniel Marlowe, and a visit from Mrs Maguire leads to Amanda having a heart-to-heart with Guy. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Mr Selfridge
programme.desc: While Harry pursues a new charitable project, Crabb is faced with a professional dilemma. The biggest fashion event in store since the end of the war proves a challenge for the staff, and an exclusive contract with the famous Parisian brand of Lanvin hangs in the balance. As Rosalie begins married life, a bored and frustrated Violette looks for something to keep herself occupied. Miss Mardle decides to make a fresh start, Agnes faces an unexpected obstacle close to home and Loxley makes trouble for Mr Selfridge.(n)

programme.title: Jekyll and Hyde
programme.desc: Maggie has developed sepsis, and Robert and his friends work tirelessly to find a cure. Garson makes an unexpected discovery about the Jekyll family's curse that could hold the key to saving her life. Dance sets his trap, making Robert a tempting offer in return for his help. However, their encounter is disrupted by Bulstrode and a gunfight ensues.(n)

programme.title: Peak Practice

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick interrupts an armed robbery at the Aidensfield Arms and ends up being held hostage in the cellar with Greengrass. Meanwhile, the local newsagent is found to be selling Swedish pornography. Rural police drama, starring Nick Berry and Bill Maynard.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: King Edward VII visits Eaton Place for a lavish dinner party, but the servants' duties are interrupted by the untimely appearance of Sarah, who is unfortunately expecting a new arrival of her own. Gordon Jackson and Jean Marsh star.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: A suicidal man refuses treatment that could save his life, presenting Mike with an ethical dilemma. Louise inadvertently puts a youngster at risk, but manages to save him with a radical new technique, while on the personal front, Christine fights to pull her marriage back from the brink. Medical drama set in a busy A&E department, starring Martin Shaw, Niamh Cusack, David Harewood and Esther Hall.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth falls asleep during a flight from Paris to London, while a female passenger is murdered by a poisoned dart, leaving few clues to the killer's identity. Poirot soon discovers she was a money-lender, which may provide a motive for the killing. The investigation is turned on its head, however, when the victim's illegitimate daughter comes forward to claim the inheritance. Whodunit, starring David Suchet, with David Firth, Jenny Downham and John Bleasdale.(n)

programme.title: Broadchurch
programme.desc: Ellie and Hardy start to investigate Trish's life and talk to her ex-husband Ian, her best friend's partner Jim, and taxi driver Lucas - all of whom were in the area when the attack took place. The detectives need Trish to give her main video interview, which will be relied on in court if the case goes that far, but she is still traumatised. Hardy decides they should go ahead, but Trish brings the interview to a premature end when they ask her a question she is not prepared to answer. Crime drama, starring David Tennant and Olivia Colman.(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective is brought in to investigate when a former Met police officer is stabbed to death outside a nightclub in Newcastle. The team initially suspects a crime of passion after it emerges the victim had recently rekindled his affair with his childhood sweetheart, whose husband has a history of violence. However, Vera uncovers evidence pointing to a more complex case involving inside information and the hostile takeover of a brewery. What did the deceased find out that cost him his life? Guest starring Jill Halfpenny, Christine Bottomley, Ralph Ineson and Liam Cunningham.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: A team of investigators responds to reports of animal cruelty, rescuing pets and dealing with abusive owners.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The investigators look back at the most shocking cases of the series, and relive the stories of despair, neglect, rescue and hope.(n)

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Tanya Rider, who disappeared in September 2007 on her way home from work in Maple Valley, Washington. Barely alive, she was discovered eight days later at the bottom of a steep ravine inside her wrecked car.(n)

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The story of an undercover operation, codenamed `Safe Bet', which targeted corrupt police officers and their connections with the Chicago Mafia.(n)

programme.title: Evil Online
programme.desc: The case of real-estate agent Beverly Carter, who failed to return after arranging to meet a prospective buyer at a remote Arkansas house in September 2014. After her body was discovered in a shallow grave, Arron Lewis was accused of kidnapping and killing the 50-year-old as a part of a ransom plot.(n)

programme.title: Dateline with Tamzin Outhwaite
programme.desc: The case of missing mother Marie. It soon transpired she was secretly working for the CIA, so when she vanished, parallel investigations were launched.(n)

programme.title: Reasonable Doubt
programme.desc: The case of rapper Mac Phipps. After a young fan was shot and killed at one of his concerts in a Louisiana club, Mac was arrested and convicted for the crime.(n)

programme.title: Grave Secrets
programme.desc: The 1995 case of Wendy Kratzert, whose van initially appeared to have skidded off the road. On closer inspection, police ruled out misadventure as the cause of her death.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: An explanation of how difficult it is to determine the cause of death in victims who have been subdued with sedatives.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Cases in which partners teamed up to commit murder, including execution-style killings by two taxi drivers in New Jersey. Plus, an insight into a new DNA identification technique.(n)

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: A case in which a mother failed to return home from work on a winter's night. As dawn broke, her murdered body was found in a nearby churchyard, and CCTV was called upon to solve the mystery of her death.(n)

programme.title: Nightmare Next Door
programme.sub-title: Dear Katherine, It's Me the Killer.
programme.desc: The case of 18-year-old Katherine Foster. When she went missing in February 1980, terror stuck the heart of the University of South Alabama, with residents wondering whether there was a killer in their midst.(n)

programme.title: FBI Case Files
programme.desc: Officers investigate the abduction of Christine Aragao and her two young children in Miami just days before Christmas, hoping to determine who has kidnapped them before it is too late.(n)

programme.title: Swamp Murders
programme.desc: The case of evangelist Kenneth Richardson, whose body was found floating in the sea at a Florida beach in October 2001 with an arrow piercing his torso. During the investigation it transpired the victim was gay and routinely sought out homosexual liaisons at outdoor locations.(n)

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town

programme.desc: A case in which a California couple's son was convicted of their brutal murder. However, one of the victim's sisters was convinced her nephew was wrongfully convicted, so turned to investigators Chris Anderson and Melissa Lewkowicz for help.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Triathletes Ron and Mel plan to sell their family home and buy two new properties with the proceeds. The pair look for a small house in the area of Kent where they already live and a ski chalet in the Les Gets area of France, where they want to enjoy winter and summer sports with friends and family.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Professor Noel Fitzpatrick performs a risky procedure to save the life of an 18-week-old cockapoo puppy that has fractured its neck following an accident in the garden. He also comes to the aid of Romanian stray Geoffrey, who was found abandoned and emaciated before being adopted by Kent couple John and Stacey, and an accident-prone cat called MK who has fallen from a window.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners of the Sea Verge Hotel in Paignton, Devon, try to prove their B&B offers the best value for money. However, Tony and Chris Fulbrook's guests are far from happy, with Christine Hale complaining about the noise from the sea and scolding Chris for serving breakfast in her slippers.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition moves on to the Portcullis Hotel in Chipping Sodbury, Gloucestershire, where mother-and-daughter owners Christine and Jenna Hale make a poor first impression by cajoling their guests into taking part in a karaoke session that runs until 2am. Matters worsen the following day, as a caricaturing workshop does little to alleviate the tension among the contestants.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Entrepreneur Andy Scott hosts at the Orchid Hotel in Bournemouth, and takes on Richard Bailey in the boxing gym. Christine and Jenna Hale are unhappy to find foreign objects in their beds, and a spot of flirting is brought to a swift halt when the owner receives some negative feedback.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last hosts of the week are John and Debbie Fox from Friary Wood near Bath, who are hoping to impress their guests with the spacious en-suite rooms and a cocktail-making course.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to learn how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers before discovering who has won the week's competition. Old tensions resurface as the results are announced, and there are heated exchanges around the table.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: A couple have decided to sell their family home to fund their dreams of a house abroad. Jonnie Irwin helps them look for a smaller house in Cirencester where they already live, while Laura Hamilton takes them around properties in western France where they want to spend their retirement.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Property experts Jonnie Irwin and Laura Hamilton help a couple on the verge of retirement decide between homes either side of the Channel. While Tony has his eye on Shropshire, an area he feels is familiar and beautiful, Kimm is drawn to the French way of life the Dordogne offers.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Gold in the Moat: Codnor Castle, Derbyshire.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team brave treacherous mine-shafts to piece together the layout of Codnor Castle in Derbyshire, former residence of the De Grey family, who fought in almost every important medieval battle. The excavation lives up to expectations when the team uncovers the remains of a large round tower and a drawbridge.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Towcester, Northamptonshire: The Naughty Nuns of Northampton.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and his crew of archaeologists investigate a collection of relics discovered in the garden of a suburban family in Northamptonshire. Among the artefacts are what appear to be a collection of unusual sarcophagi from the ruins of Sewardsley Priory, a 900-year-old nunnery linked at various times in the past with witchcraft, begging and debauchery.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Car enthusiast Tim Shaw and master mechanic Fuzz Townshend travel to Leicestershire to rescue a Jaguar E-Type. After ill health turned school caretaker Mick's dream of owning one the 1960s supercars into a nightmare, the team is on hand to get the iconic car back on the road.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A five-year-old Great Dane is rushed to Fitzpatrick Referrals after losing the use of its back legs due to a slipped disc, with complications leaving the dog fighting for its life. A woman and her two children bring their pet spaniel to the practice after it is hit by a car, and a 10-year-old collie with hip dysplasia visits the surgery.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Stonemason Adam Purchase and his partner Nicola Brennan try to restore a dilapidated Grade II-listed silver-mine engine-house in Cornwall. With a budget of £100,000, Adam takes a year off work to transform the property into a new home, but has to rely on favours to complete the project before he runs out of time.(n)

programme.title: Selling Houses with Amanda Lamb
programme.desc: The host helps Oxfordshire sellers Colin and Teresa, Ben and Donna, and Larry and Lynette give their houses a makeover in the hope of winning an offer from buyers Polly and Paul.(n)

programme.title: The Baby Boomers' Guide to Growing Old
programme.desc: Seasoned celebrities explore alternative ways to make a living, though journalist Eve Pollard and campaigner Stanley Johnson struggle as assistants at a DIY store.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay tries to help a struggling seafood restaurant in Manhattan, where the three owners regularly come into conflict as they each try to assert their authority over the business, causing confusion for all. When one of the trio stubbornly resists the changes the Scottish chef is hoping to implement, sparks begin to fly.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef takes on one of his toughest challenges yet, J Willy's Bar and Grille in South Bend, Indiana, which has amassed debts of more than $1million. On finding an inexperienced chef serving food from both the freezer and tins, together with service that reduces one customer to tears, Gordon Ramsay orders an overnight deep-clean of the premises and designs a menu to inspire the kitchen staff.(n)

programme.title: Selling Houses with Amanda Lamb
programme.desc: The host helps Oxfordshire sellers Colin and Teresa, Ben and Donna, and Larry and Lynette give their houses a makeover in the hope of winning an offer from buyers Polly and Paul.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Stonemason Adam Purchase and his partner Nicola Brennan try to restore a dilapidated Grade II-listed silver-mine engine-house in Cornwall. With a budget of £100,000, Adam takes a year off work to transform the property into a new home, but has to rely on favours to complete the project before he runs out of time.(n)

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt visits the town of Tequila on the trail of Mexico's national drink as he tries to find out where the idea of a worm in the bottle came from, while Jimmy Doherty learns how Poles transform carp into a much-loved national delicacy. Kate Quilton visits Spain to explore the difference between tangerines, mandarins, satsumas and clementines.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: A couple have decided to sell their family home to fund their dreams of a house abroad. Jonnie Irwin helps them look for a smaller house in Cirencester where they already live, while Laura Hamilton takes them around properties in western France where they want to spend their retirement.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A five-year-old Great Dane is rushed to Fitzpatrick Referrals after losing the use of its back legs due to a slipped disc, with complications leaving the dog fighting for its life. A woman and her two children bring their pet spaniel to the practice after it is hit by a car, and a 10-year-old collie with hip dysplasia visits the surgery.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners of the musically themed Harmony B&B in Torquay, Devon, begin the competition, trying to prove their establishment offers the best value for money. Dutch hosts Hans MacDaniel and Monica van der Meij try to impress their guests, but it remains to be seen what they will make of wheelchair badminton, saxophones at breakfast and a controversial sausage.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest continues at Chimneys B&B in North Walsham, Norfolk, where owners Jenny and Richard Harmer's decision to use a flag as a tablecloth angers Hans MacDaniel and Monica Van Der Meij. The argument seems to abate during an afternoon canoeing session - only to resurface at breakfast the following day.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Beverley Conoley and Caroline Pocklington host at the Wordsworth Hotel in Cockermouth, Cumbria. They take their guests to a spa and Hans MacDaniel happily volunteers for a spray tan, while Richard Harmer is far more uncomfortable as he finds himself on a massage table. The day ends with dinner at a nearby bistro, but Jenny Harmer complains about the temperature.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Mother and daughter Lesley and Emily Gray play host at the Park Farm guest house in Gateshead, but while the evening's entertainment featuring a ride on a two-wheeled personal transporter goes down well among the guests, tensions simmer when the dinner conversation turns to a delicate issue.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to learn how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers before discovering who has won the week's competition. Old tensions resurface as the results are announced, and there are heated exchanges around the table.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: First-time buyer Nicki Burridge has a deposit ready for her first house, but cannot decide whether to buy in her home town of St Peter Port in Guernsey, or in the Vendee region of western France, where she hopes to eventually live. Luke Doonan and Laura Hamilton show her some homes to help make up her mind.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps a couple with a budget of £175,000 find a retirement home in Shropshire, while Jasmine searches for a suitable property in the Alpujarras region of Spain.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: South London: Blitzkrieg on Shooters Hill.
programme.desc: The archaeologists arrive in the south London district of Shooters Hill to look for evidence of the secret bunkers and anti-tank weapons that formed the capital's line of defence against a possible Nazi invasion during the Second World War. Tony Robinson meets the people who were there, including former members of the Home Guard, and imagines what life might have been like had the Germans landed in Britain.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Stonton Wyville, Leicestershire: Saxons on the Edge.
programme.desc: Tony and the team are in Stonton Wyville, Leicestershire to investigate evidence of an Anglo-Saxon settlement after locals found pieces of 1,200-year-old pottery in a field.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Shaw and master mechanic Fuzz Townshend head to Brighton to secretly restore a 1984 Audi UR Quattro, which has been under a tarpaulin on a drive for 10 years. Owner Barry has dreamed of working on the vehicle, but health issues have left him sapped of energy and unable to fulfil his wish.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Professor Noel Fitzpatrick tends to a Newfoundland called Billy, who clocks up thousands of miles travelling back and forth from his home in Aberdeen for treatment on its legs. He also attempts to help Barney, a Yorkshire terrier that has a deformity in its neck that is compressing its spinal cord. For owners Linda and Barry, Noel is their last chance, but the operation involves high-risk surgery with no guarantee of success.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud revisits a couple who took on the task of constructing a sustainable two-storey timber house in the Kent countryside, heated by glass panels. Mimi da Costa managed the project despite a lack of experience, while her husband Andre worked and looked after the children, intending to have it completed in 16 weeks. But as the complex build threatened to drag on for months, it became unclear whether their home would succeed in blending into the landscape and provide them with a greener, healthier lifestyle.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: New series. A couple face a challenging build in the beach side suburb of North Bondi, Sydney, with no guarantee of how or when their multi-tiered house will ever be completed.(n)

programme.title: The Secrets of Sleep
programme.desc: This episode follows a woman who has not slept properly for over 10 years after witnessing a traumatic accident, and her attempts to overcome her troublesome disorder.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: The One with Two Parts. This episode marks the first appearance of Phoebe's (Lisa Kudrow) twin sister, Ursula (also played by Kudrow), who is the exact opposite of the considerate and peace-loving Phoebe. Joey starts to date Ursula, which annoys Phoebe because she doesn't get along with her sister. Meanwhile, Ross (David Schwimmer) attends Lamaze class with Susan (Jessica Hecht) and Carol (Jane Sibbett). As Carol voices her anxiety about going through with the pregnancy, Ross also begins to come to terms with his role as a father; much humor is made over who gets to play the father role in the class exercises. Across town, Chandler (Matthew Perry) is dating Nina (Jennifer Grant), an employee he cannot bring himself to fire -- instead, he tells the other office workers that she is insane and too imbalanced to let go. When Nina asks why her co-workers are avoiding her, Chandler says that perhaps they are jealous of their relationship. After Marcel, Ross' monkey, changes Monica's (Courteney Cox) TV to Spanish mode, the gang sits around and watches it. This leads Joey to make the astute observation that "Urkel" is spelled the same way in Spanish as it is in English. Helen Hunt and Leila Kenzle show up at Central Perk as Jamie and Fran, their characters from Mad About You. This episode is part one of a two-part episode that originally aired on February 23, 1995(n)

programme.title: Live 2017 FIFA Confederations Cup
programme.desc: Portugal v Chile (Kick-off 7.00pm). Coverage of the opening semi-final from Kazan Arena in Russia. Hosts Brazil earned a hard-fought 2-1 victory over South American rivals Uruguay in the corresponding fixture when the tournament was last held four years ago. The Canarinho would go on to defeat then-reigning world champions Spain in the final, with two goals from Fred and a third from Neymar - who was due to join Barcelona after the tournament - securing a 3-0 victory at the Maracana in Rio de Janeiro. Presented by Peter Collins, with commentary by George Hamilton and Ronnie Whelan, and analysis from Dietmar Hamann and Richie Sadlier. Subsequent programmes are subject to change.(n)

programme.title: Lethal Weapon

In Delhi, he gains an insight into arranged marriages by going on a date with a prospective wife - and her parents - and in Bangalore, he is asked to help a pair of elite wedding planners.
